The chicken wing was a bit better than at Crave. It was somewhat crispy but nothing special - it wasn't particularly tasty. The rice was ok - nothing special. The sambal was pretty good. The fried egg was decent. The begadil did not have much flavour.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: Last year, I had one the best dishes I've had in my life. This was a much hyped trip to the Adam Hawker Center to try the famous Selera Rasa Nasi Lemak. I have watched many videos including YouTube food blogger, Mark Weins, in my preparation for my trip to Singapore and for this dish. Be warned of the immediate long lines as this is by far the busiest stand in the hawker center. I remember waiting for a half-hour and seeing my friends enjoy their dishes from the other vendors. The wait is long, but luckily, you will be able to relate and potentially make some friends while waiting. Once you reach the register, you will have the option to order one of seven dishes depending on how much variety / portion / adventure you prefer. It begins with the simple "Flash Meal" of rice, eggs, cucumbers, and anchovies to the right spectrum of the "Royal Rumble" which has all of that + the side dishes and is about 3x the size. I wanted to get the full experience and understand exactly what makes this place unique, different, and regularly visited by the president of Brunei (one of the famous regular customers) of this establishment. Hence, I ordered the "Royal Rumble." - Royal Rumble (+5/5) - This dish was incredible. I had to spend about 5 minutes in the beginning to analyze and take the pictures that it deserved. The Nasi Lamak is packed with coconut steamed rice, anchovies, fried egg, chicken, pandan wrapped leaf thingy, and flaming hot chili paste. It is a one, two, punch. - One of the greatest dishes I've had and a beautiful representation of Singapore and its neighboring cuisines. Make sure to use your left hand to eat this dish as utensils will do no justice. Overall, this is hands down a beautiful dish and one that would make me fly to Singapore for!

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: Paya Lebar Square.. looks good and decided to try. First time.Served by a 百万 cashier. The other crew were great.. busy.Wanted to order different stuff but 百万 pointed me to the fixed set menu on the displayed board. In the end, got what I wanted.Ordered Chengdol, 百万   'Sold out'. Its 12noon and I'm not convinced that's the answer.I would prefer a truth than a lie.Didn't know it's a franchise shop as I was hoping to patronize an individual setting up his/her biz.So much for dedication to works and service with a smile.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: Royal rumble ($5.90) - 3.5 starsIt was a 15-20 min wait on a Monday around noon. The good: probably that the fried egg wasn't over cooked (the yolk was all yellow and didn't have a blue-ish grey exterior), the fish was less dry than the one at No 1 Nasi Lemak next door, the rice was light, and there were no peanuts (not a big fan). Otah was alright. But overall I'm not terribly impressed. I guess I'm not picky about my nasi lemak and I'm content with nasi lemak and nasi padang dishes at most places.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: I'm going to write this review without excessive philosophizing, ranting or use of the "I" word.  There will be no lengthy back story.  I wouldn't be saying anything new anyway, since Selera Rasa has been on TV, blogged about and reviewed ad nauseum.  Little wonder why, since this is arguably Singapore's best nasi lemak.Imagine a simple 3 ingredient high.  The rich fragrance of basmati rice simmered and steamed in coconut milk and pandan leaves, the abrupt spicy heat of a sweet chili pepper coulis, and the savory comfort of a curry-fried chicken wing.  There are other condiments, a fried egg, cucumber slices and ikan bills, the ubiquitous accompaniment to any self-respecting nasi lemak, but your brain is past caring about these other players on the plate and your eyes struggle to focus on what it is exactly that you've put in your mouth that still has you reeling.  It's the triumvirate of chili, rice and curried chicken wing....trust me.I'd like to think I know a thing or two about nasi lemak, having had it just about every Saturday for tea since I was knee high to a cicak.  So I think I speak with some personal authority on the matter of whether Selera Rasa is a worthy nasi lemak hall-of-famer.  I think it is.  I also think that Selera Rasa is a victim of it's own fame. All the media coverage creates unrealistic expectations in diners who flock here only to be disappointed when angels don't appear and next week's 4D numbers fail to materialize in the basmati.  Don't expect too much, come with an open mind and set your senses free to explore and you will come away satisfied, if not pleasant surprised.It really is just honest to goodness solid quotidian fare.  Look beyond the bull-@$!# that's been piled on these guys by the media and see it for the single specialty master hawker stall that it is and you'll see what all the fuss is about.  It's just a local stall that serves good honest nasi lemak.  No gimmicks.  No fancy service.  Just think of all the superlatives that pepper reviews of the latest French restaurant, Italian joint or Spanish tapas place; why don't those same superlatives apply here?  Based on flavor alone, I see no reasonable explanation why not...unless it's the bull-@#$% these places are throwing in your eyes.Get real, get local, hug your local hawker today and tell him or her you love her.  Creepy? Yes, but necessary, oooh so necessary!

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: Review for Nov2016 - Queue wasn't too long, maybe 15-20 minutes during the lunch hour and can't recall if I got the Full House or Royal Flush, but was definitely very delicious and would come back again. Everything was fried just right and very flavorful.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: My first time at this stall.Using basmati rice is not a bad idea, but it is too soft and sticky.Nasi Lemak's rice should be slightly more solid and separated.Sambal Chilli is excellent.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: Adam Road Food Centre. This is another local only food place, but has been touted as the best in Singapore and I can understand why. I ordered the Full House.  Includes rice (basmati rice), thick slice of cucumber, sambal sauce, fried chicken wing, otak otak (fish paste in banana leaf), ikan bilis (small dried fish) and a fried egg. Awesome!The key here is that they use Basmati rice. Makes a huge difference.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: We did timing the queue, it takes almost an hour.Probably we came at the wrong timing, Sunday brunch time.I would like to say, you can taste coconut milk on the rice, which probably quite seldom in Singapore.Nice Sambal which not too spicy, with crispy chicken wing, fish, anchovies/ikan bilis and otah.Now left with the queue, whether it worth or not is up to you, to me one hour queue probably not.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: My parents and I used to come here every Saturday morning to have breakfast before the lines start snaking. I wouldn't go as far as saying that Selera has the best nasi lemak in Singapore, but it's pretty damn close. The Good: Basmati Rice. Begadil. Sweet & Spicy Sambal.The Bad: Long lines. Food is occasionally cold.The Ugly:People before you in line ordering 874893278932 packs of Nasi LemakCome here for a life changing experience, but be prepared to line up for a while before you get there.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: We sought this place out because it was on the Food Network, and supposedly the sultan of Brunei visits this stall when he's in Singapore.  I think their main claim to fame is that they make their nasi lemak with basmati rice, which makes it a little bit lighter.  I'm not sure that it's really that much better than any other nasi lemak I've had in Singapore, but it definitely is good.  The rice is packed with aromatic coconut flavor, and the fried chicken wing that comes with the set was crispy and juicy.  I'm also a big fan of their sambal; it's spicier than most, a little sweet, and not too salty.It's debatable whether this is truly food fit for royalty, but it's more than good enough for me.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: To find this stall, follow the queue. Okay, maybe not quite. There are two famous nasi lemak stalls in Adam Road Food Centre, side by side. One of them is the first shop of the food centre, this one is the second. Ironically, I find that the better one is in second place. Fair enough as well, as Selera Rasa seems to be open longer hours than the other one does. Most of the time when you're there you ought to be prepared to queue up for a good twenty minutes, because many people come in line not just to order one plate, or two boxes, but a party-load of it. That just shows how good it is. The rice is always at such a good texture, though I find that its taste can be quite a hit and miss sometimes, and lacks that bit of coconut flavour to it. But Selera Rasa more than makes up for whatever's lacking with such good sambal chilli, so the rice becomes a little matter.The gold is in the chicken. The colour is so wonderfully golden, you only have to look at it to tell that it will be such a crispy treat. Inside the chicken is still so juicy and so tender, though a little oily, and it makes you wish you had more than one on your plate - which is why I always ask for two. The ikan bilis is very well fried, and as a personal bonus, don't come automatically with the nuts, as they usually tend to do, thus saving me all that time and effort in removing it.Word on the street is that the nasi lemak from this stall is one of President Tony Tan's favourite food...so 'nuff said I hope!

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: Suprisingly, using basmati rice for nasi lemak work quite well - it's not too separated as I expect like briyani and the coconut taste can still stand out. The sides is just ok for me you can choose between otah, bergedil, fried wing, fried fish, or egg with combo named just like in poker. Somehow I think the portion is too small for the price it charges.

address: 2 Adam Rd Food Centre Singapore 289876 Singapore
comment: I'm not so sure whats so special about this place (except that I confess the basmati rice makes it more fluffy) but I'm a sucker all the same

address: 9 North Buona Vista Drive #02-02, The Metropolis Singapore 138588 Singapore
comment: Only 1minute walking from buona vista MRT. Good service and nice environment. Today has special offer for curry Fish head costed $28++. A very big bowl and too much for two ppl. Overall it is a good place to eat near MRT station.

address: 118 Holland Ave #02-01 Raffles @ Holland Village Singapore 278990 Singapore
comment: The place was next to the escalators, with not much customers. However one could spot a number of tables especially the sofa bench side with the reserved sign on.There was 2-course and 3-course lunch set but the mains did not interest me. So decided to have a la carte. Water was served.Truffle Mushroom Capellini ($18++)63 degree Celsius Egg, Eryngii Mushroom, Parmesan Crisp, Mushroom Cream, Black Truffle OilThe dish smelt quite nice of truffle when served. The pasta was well braised in a rich and thick sauce, with the poached egg making the sauce even more richer. The Parmesan Crisp was light and savoury, making one wishing for more.  Burnt Banana Waffle ($12++)Smoky grilled banana over buttermilk waffle, topped with peanut butter gelato and a freeze-dried bananaThe waffle was light and cripy although I would prefer it to be less dense and more airy. The peanut butter gelato was creamy without too sweet, while the banana was so soft and sweet. Service was not bad with the staffs being quite friendly and making recommendations.

address: 118 Holland Ave #02-01 Raffles @ Holland Village Singapore 278990 Singapore
comment: My initial thought was 3 stars: the staff was not overly friendly when seating us and the only option given for water was a $5 bottle of mineral water.However, my mood mellowed when the food came, I had hanger steak, I have rarely seen this cut in Singapore and it was a success. I can honestly say that this is to me one of the better, if not, the best, steak dish I had at this price point ($22++). The beef was tasty and perfectly cooked. I was also pleasantly surprised by the fries, they were thick cut and nicely spiced.We also had the parmesan waffle and bacon ice cream waffle to finish the meal and again, this was one of the better desserts I had in a while. It is not sweet at all, just a slight hint of sweetness but not overly savory either, just a good balance I guess. I am guessing this is not one to pick if you have a real sweet tooth though!I was tempted to give Otto's 5 stars as I find the food worth it, however there is two things which make me hesitate:* The service was at times reasonable but also at times your typical Singaporean service (i.e. bad): rude welcoming, the paid bottle of water was warm and the ice provided was only sufficient to cool one glass of water, no cutlery for desserts,....* This is a relatively new opening in Holland V and I want to see if they keep up the food standard.So, I am definitely going back (since it is close to where I live), if they manage to maintain the food standard and up their service, I will consider upgrading it to 5 stars, however, if the food quality goes south a downgrade is also in the books. To be continued!

address: 118 Holland Ave #02-01 Raffles @ Holland Village Singapore 278990 Singapore
comment: Don't estimate this place because of its appellation ('deli') or appearance - a doorless eatery on top of an escalator. Not only it's a proper restaurant with several chefs in the kitchen, but it's the junior branch of the famous Otto Ristorante by Maxwell's Chambers. The revamped menu now is more 'adult' than before. Pastas are good, perhaps a bit under salted but maybe that's in line with being in the Raffles Health building. Reasonably-priced wines, although not many wines by the glass on offer. Charming service staff - could be a bit more pro-active though.

Nice tangy asam and soft slurppy noodles.I like the tangy base, with the opinions and fresh veg it adds a dimension to noodles, like the way Vietnamese Pho brings to our local palate.Nice addition to the local scene.

Asam Laksa has taken its spot over the Western Stall in West Coast Square. It was kind of mix feelings as on one hand I was sad to hear that there are only 1 option left for western food but on the other hand I was quite happy to see this unique stall out there.Asam Laksa is a chain stalls with staff in uniform. Hygiene is well taken care of over here with friendly servers wearing hair net.Asam Laksa - $3.50Noodles were thick and springy, soaking up the delicious gravy and made the bowl of Asam Laksa so appetizing. Ingredients like pineapple and large chunks of fish were given in the serving. Apparently, there is only 1 standard size served at $3.50.Serving was small and it will be better if it was served in bigger size at the same cost.

address: Blk 159 Mei Chin Road #02-21, Mei Ling Street Food Centre Singapore 140159 Singapore
comment: Soup very good... Nice to have something cooling n lite after all the other foods... That are normally heavy..

address: 10 Kent Ridge Cres #01-02 AS8 Building NUS Singapore 119260 Singapore
comment: A refreshing place with a quiet ambience and nice view. The coffee has great reviews, although I did not try it myself. Food wise it's a variety of brown rice dishes or salads. Probably very appealing for the health-conscious. My friend had rendang chicken. While the taste was not bad, she preferred a stronger flavor. I had BBQ chicken. The meat was tender and the taste was fragrant. I like the mixture of different textures from the brown rice, potatoes, cashew nuts and chicken. Ala carte is $4.80 whereas a meal with honey lemon iced tea is $5.90 which is a pretty good deal.

address: Blk 448 Clementi Avenue 3 #01-38, Clementi Hawker Centre And Food Market Singapore 120448 Singapore
comment: One of the best fish soup I have ever eaten. By the time I was in the queue at 7:20pm, they have sold out everything except the fried fish and thick bee hoon. They helped to prevent customers from wasting time by continuing to tell new people joining the queue what is still left. The soup is really well brewed with a distinct taste of fish without the fishy ness. The cabbage and bitter gourd slices were a nice touch. I'd definitely recommend that you give it a try and come early!

If you're into music and beer, then this is probably a good place, but their Thai food is not as good as other Thai restaurants here.  We had their green curry, prawn cakes and noodle dishes and all were underwhelming.  Considering the price, they should really improve their quality.
The beers are pretty good here, the service is excellent and I loved the Thai food; don't get talked into 'Thai hot' though ;-)  All really good and definitely a recommend...

Tawandang Microbrewery is an interesting concept, Thai food and German beer.  The menu was huge for the food section, very small for the beer I think there were 4 options.  My Pad Thai was very good and my friend both seem to enjoy there dishes.  As for their beer there wasn't a sampler option which I was bummed about so I picked one and it was so-so.  There were different size but as in all of Singapore the drinks were on the price side and the most economical option to me seemed like the  1/2 pint vs the 10 oz for a few dollars more you get a lot more beer.   Worth a trip for the food the beer maybe I just picked the wrong one?  Idk I love German beer so it could of just been the beer.

Came here on a business trip to Singapore, at my coworkers' suggestion. It's a little hard to find, kind of buried deep inside this tucked-away commercial district in Dempsey. They have an extensive menu, all done very well. We were a large group and ordered several different dishes - probably at least a dozen, and without fail, they each were tasty, and eagerly scarfed down. The ambience is nice - they had a live band singing the standard American songbook (50s/60s/70s/80s pop, rock, etc., including modern day pop).The only thing that might be disappointing is if you're a beer/microbrewery connoisseur, particularly if you've been to a place in the US like Portland, OR. Nothing about this place said "microbrewery" other than the name and a decent beer menu itself. I guess it's just that when I think of a microbrewery, I tend to think of places that have all the machinery you tend to see at every other notable microbrewery. Without that hardware, I don't know how you're not just a bar serving lots of different kinds of beers, like any other bar, if that makes sense. Myself, I'm not much of a drinker, so I wasn't particularly disappointed, but a number of my colleagues did notice and mention the same thing I did about the place. Prices seemed really good, but maybe because of the relatively strong dollar. We ate very well, for not a whole lot of money. I would definitely come back.
Try the Pork knuckles and Sticky mango rice, they are above averageDon't forget to try the Dunkel Beer!Prices are on the high side, but i guess someone needs to pay for the live band.

Until now, I've never given a 1 star review on Yelp. Unfortunately, I found it hard not to do so after my first and likely last visit ever to this microbrewery. My girlfriend and I stopped in with some friends for a drink in the mid afternoon. I had heard good things and am always excited to try a microbrewery. It was 1 for 1 on all beers, and I started with the Weisen. I am usually a big fan of Weiss beers, but this one not so much. Not sure exactly how to describe it, but it simply seemed overdone and very tart. I was happy to move on to a lager from there, but things were about to go downhill. Mid conversation, I felt something hit my back. Upon further inspection, it was bird poop...not cool, particularly for an INDOOR restaurant. Sure enough, there were birds perched in the rafters above. Thankfully I wasn't eating, but I could never return to this place for a meal without the thought that bird poop might come raining down on my meal. If you are curious, the lager wasn't great either (and I would hardly classify it as a lager--it was cloudy and almost like a wheat beer). The service was nothing special, and even a bit awkward/unhelpful at times as they had no idea what was in the mixed drinks on the menu. They tried to bring our bill before we cashed in our free beer. We then had to request the bill twice after our second round. In a highly competitive Dempsey Hill, you can do much, much better.

Visiting Singapore on business  the food is excellent. Service was fantastic. We ordered a selecton of seafood and 2 liter beer tower. The staff brought fresh frozen mugs for every pour. Great. Will definitely come back on my next trip. Live music eas also very good.

Its one of those places where the atmosphere is as important as the food (and beer) itself.  I love it that they have live music, always from Thailand, and always entertaining.  And Thai food naturally pairs well with beer, and so when you have freshly brewed beer, brewed onsite, what can beat that?

German beer, Thai food, male dancers in silver space suits, backed up by a live cover band, all come together at this spot on Dempsey Hill. It's a whacky combination but in a way, it works and can be a fun place, especially for a group.  As for the beer, you have 3 selections, a lager, a dunkel and a wheat beer.  The dunkel was probably my fave, although all 3 were super light.  As for the food, it's extensive.  The prawns in red curry was messy with the shells but the curry was good.  The fish cake was also good, but skip the grilled beef.  The duck was decent, and the fried sea bass was also very good.  And now for the show...It's a cover band that plays a lot of classics as well as more traditional Thai songs, but also takes requests.  There are more costume changes than a Pet Shop Boys concert, and boy can they sing happy birthday. Only downer is trying to catch a cab after dinner on a weekend night,

A good night out to hang around with friends ....... They have singers in the house which makes your Friday night more relaxed .....  Love the ambience and food ....... We order a large variety of food.They have indoor and outdoor seating and the service crew was nice. We order the pork knuckles, pineapple rice and beer etc ..... It's really a table full of food .....Do pop by ......

One of the most interesting dinning experiences I had at Dempsey so far. Amidst the posh dining enclave that is Dempsey hill, Tawandang sticks out like a sore thumb. Its ambiance is remarkable casual and it has a live show of some sorts. The show is an ensemble of acts from karaoke to musical (an abstract from Snow White and the seven dwarfs) to beer drinking competitions??? The host of the live show tries to engage the audience as much as possible. At times, even cajoling the waiters on stage to participate in a song & dance on stage. Strange. But entertaining nonetheless. I can't help but think that this incoherent string of performances (at times tacky & impromptu but always hospitable)... sorta mirrors restaurant/bar entertainment culture of Thailand. You sorta feel that your waiters are not just your servers. They try their best to keep you entertained throughout your dining experience even if that means they have to put together an amateurish string of performance. You can't help but feel welcomed.  At the surrounding tables, I notice clusters of friends (of all age groups) clapping, singing and cheering along with the performances. It's definitely was an entertaining night filled with authentic thai food and an ambiance to match. However, I might caution against bringing a first date here. The music is definitely too noisy for any meaningful conversations to take place (unless you opt for outdoor seating). The food 1. Cripsy prawn crackers - Great! How can one go wrong with prawn crackers???2. Pineapple fried rice - Ok. 3. Pad thai - Good. 4. Grilled squid - Ok. Not much flavor though. Could use a more intense marination? 5. Prawn spring rolls - Good. It came served with a piece of strawberry pierced though the top via a cocktail-pirate-like-sword. Strange. 6. Thai fish cake - Pass. Not impressed. 7. Fried pork knuckles - Great! Even though I do not typically like this dish. The porky smell was musk well. My only complain was that it took way too long to come (it was served almost at the end of the meal which meant that we were already 80% stuffed and had less space for this yummy dish. Everything else came very fast though, despite the crowd.) 8 . The fried seabass! It's so good :) - My favorite dish. It was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. How did they do it??? Magic. The sweet thai chili sauce was a perfect compliment to this wonderful dish. I would come back just for this. Like the pork knuckles, my only complain was that it took way too long to come. 9. Red ruby with coconut dessert - $10 - BAD. It was crazy sweet!!! sweeter than a Starbucks carmel frapp! That's how tooth-rotting it was. The coconut milk wasn't freshly made too. It tasted they used a can version. But the red rubies were ok and they threw in a few other toppings too (to be able to charge $10 for it). I found some jackfruit slices in it. However, the ridiculous level of sugar in this dessert rendered everything else inedible. The service - Remarkable fast for most dishes except #7 & #8 (which were the best). I guess mum was right when she said good things come to those who wait?

German beer, Thai food, male dancers in silver space suits, backed up by a live cover band, all come together at this spot on Dempsey Hill. It's a whacky combination but in a way, it works and can be a fun place, especially for a group.  As for the beer, you have 3 selections, a lager, a dunkel and a wheat beer.  The dunkel was probably my fave, although all 3 were super light.  As for the food, it's extensive.  The prawns in red curry was messy with the shells but the curry was good.  The fish cake was also good, but skip the grilled beef.  The duck was decent, and the fried sea bass was also very good.  And now for the show...It's a cover band that plays a lot of classics as well as more traditional Thai songs, but also takes requests.  There are more costume changes than a Pet Shop Boys concert, and boy can they sing happy birthday. Only downer is trying to catch a cab after dinner on a weekend night,
Had beers and appetizers. indoor & outdoor seating, quiet and comfortable. Enjoyed the beer and food.I preferred the beer from a nearby brewer... But ya gotta love Thai food.

Visiting Singapore on business  the food is excellent. Service was fantastic. We ordered a selecton of seafood and 2 liter beer tower. The staff brought fresh frozen mugs for every pour. Great. Will definitely come back on my next trip. Live music eas also very good.

Its one of those places where the atmosphere is as important as the food (and beer) itself.  I love it that they have live music, always from Thailand, and always entertaining.  And Thai food naturally pairs well with beer, and so when you have freshly brewed beer, brewed onsite, what can beat that?

Interesting stop on my self guided Singapore beer tour. Only 3 beers on tap and their Dunkel was the winner. Paired it with the wings which looked skinny but were very tasty with the Thai sauce. Came during slow period but could see this as a great spot for date night. They got a nice stage for entertainment and comfy outdoor seating with soft rock classics.

Not a fan of the beer but great Thai food!Try the deep fried catfish and Tawadang morning glory!Light beer better than the dark.Slightly pricey but you have to factor in the location and live band and performances.Overall good service.

Went here for dinner for a b'day party. We were a group of 8. Arrived late but was seated promptly. Food selection is vast, they tasted good, especially the Tom Yum Soup (Shrimp/Chicken). The Crab Meat Fried Rice is very very good. In fact, everything that we ordered, except the Thai Teas were delicious. The performers were singing and they sound quite good. The one THING I did not like was the behavior of this middle aged lady who works there. She was not wearing a uniform like the rest of the waitstaffs did, she was always going around hovering at tables looking SOUR faced. When she tried to bring food to our table, we were trying to tell her which food goes to where, and she looked Displeased. Very sour and unprofessional. The whole night she looked sour. She could be a manager or maybe the owner herself. But this made me NOT want to come back. Food was good, but wow. The waitstaffs were ok, not too friendly, but not rude either.The 4 stars above is STRICTLY for the FOOD. For the service I would rate them a 1 Star.

Beautiful little spot south of the botanical gardens. Friendly wait staff full of suggestions. A menu with classic dishes mixed with Singaporean flavors. They have their own version of bulletproof coffee as an espresso too!

Nice ambience. That's the only thing going for it.For mains, only the salad was good but the mushrooms were too saltish. Soft serve Thai iced tea flavour ice cream - not badOverall - I wouldn't bother going there again. Waste of stomach space and calories.

The attentive service is the best thing at this place. We went for lunch, and because it was a public holiday, only had the brunch menu, with limited choices. In terms of quality, the food is not bad, but certainly not memorable. We've all had much better versions of the dishes we ordered - burger, lobster roll, spiced lentils, kale salad, scotch egg, etc - at lower prices too! Dempsey Cookhouse is definitely better!

Beancurd & assorted seafood braised in claypot was pretty good. The tofu was pretty smooth, the prawn fresh & the gravy tasty.King prawn stir fried with garlic & glazed soya featured huge ass prawns - they were the King of King Prawns. The dish was excellent. The sauce was very tasty & the prawns were fresh.Half Golden Phoenix Chicken was decent. It was chicken skin with a prawn mix under it. It was somewhat springy but heavily cut with other stuff.Supreme seafood fried rice was good. There was a good wok flavour. It was not heavy on the palate.Mee goreng was decent. It was on the sweet side & not very spicy.

Reviewing Jumbo as a local eater is something of a delicate task.  For better or for worse, Jumbo has gotten a reputation as the place tourists go to have Singapore's other national dish, chili crab.   So there is  pressure to pan this most famous of Jumbo's offerings or to at least to throw shade at every perceived flaw or misgiving.  The fact of the matter is that when I had the chili crab yesterday, these were my findings: the crab was fresh and the firm succulent flesh tasted of the sea.  The palate of the sauce was balanced and had enough heft, spice and Singapore character to make this a proper chili crab.  The consistency of the  sauce was not starchy or watery, boasting a satisfying depth which made the mantou-dipping all the more pleasurable, the way it clung to the deep-fried bun glisteningly was almost lascivious.  The bottom line is that the fresh ingredient was allowed to shine while the dish also amply showcased the culinary chops that made Jumbo a household name in Singapore seafood.

I came by the recommendation of a friend. The service of this restaurant is super, staff are so friendly, and attentive. The foods taste good, and comes quick, if you like seafoods, this is the place, but only when you do not mind spending big $$$.  Their price is insane. for a lobster, I was charged 190 Singapore yuan.  For a meal for two, we spent over 400 Singapore yuan for only 2-3 dishes. definitely will not go back to this place.

As the reputation precedes them chili crabs follow by the black pepper crabs are undoubtedly the National Dishes of Singapore. It is not to state the fact that Singapore has many other fabulous food choices but as the saying goes if you haven't had chili crabs you haven't been to Singapore. And what better place to enjoy such exquisite delight other than Jumbo Seafood. Ask any Singaporean and one would tell you Jumbo Seafood is synonymous with chili crabs. It isn't just the Singapore chili crabs, when it comes to seafood in any southeast Asian countries, "from tank to table" is the only acceptable way. Never frozen nor even "freshly caught" they were swimming in the tank before it's served to patrons. One could instantly taste texture difference between live seafood vs. frozen products and all is sold be weight. On another interesting note, it is customary that restaurants server the best dish for last. One should not overly indulge on the variety of other exotic and equally fantastic dishes that precedes it.  Save  some room for the mango flavored shave ice that caps the night's festivity.

This place was superb. The food options were very great as it had lots of seafood to choose. We chose the feature dish of jumbo chili crab. We ordered two type of buns: fried and steamed to dip into the chili crab sauce. We also ordered the scallops, it was great! The service was wonderful as it provided with all the tools to avoid the mess that it requires to eat crabs. The tools were: plastic cover for your belongings, plastic bag for your phone, cover for your clothes, and many more. We also ordered fried shrimps,veggies, meegoreng, and many more. It was an awesome experience!

I've been meaning to write a review for this place...on my recent trip to Singapore..everyone suggested to try this place. It's the best and biggest crab ever!!! I also loveeee the duck salad...I was one happy girl!

Odd place.  Kids running like wild animals with no supervision? Main course of spicy crab takes over one hour to be served.  Food is good but the other antics destroy the atmosphere.  Service poor, food good.  Best for tables of 8 or more.  Best outside or private room.

Delicious seafood close to the city! This location is most easily reached by car, so I would suggest driving or grabbing a ride as it's situated in the heart of the Dempsey estate. It's a great place to bring out of town guests as the air conditioning and upscale decor are pleasing and comfortable, compared to its seaside location which can be tricky when it's rainy.
My first time trying chilli crab and it was amazing!The restaurant was very clean and modern, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious. I will definitely be back for more.

Chilli crab: 80$ for 900g of Chilli crabService: 3/5 no complaints, just that staff do what is required of them only....nothing moreTaste: given many of these crabs are flown in from Sri Lanka, I'd recommend trying this in places like Ministry of Crab or Far Crab in Sri Lanka. Preferred dining experience & taste at Ministry. Repeat: no

I came by the recommendation of a friend. The service of this restaurant is super, staff are so friendly, and attentive. The foods taste good, and comes quick, if you like seafoods, this is the place, but only when you do not mind spending big $$$.  Their price is insane. for a lobster, I was charged 190 Singapore yuan.  For a meal for two, we spent over 400 Singapore yuan for only 2-3 dishes. definitely will not go back to this place.

Out of all the Jumbo branches in Singapore this one in Dempsey is hands down my favorite. The food simply tasted better than any other place and the service is far superior; you get your food quick and the service was very friendly. It is tough picking between the two flavors, but for me the chilli crab slightly edges out the black pepper crab. Fortunately I've had enough people in my party to try both. The chilli crab has a nice balance of sweet and spicy flavor. It comes in a rich, delicious eggy broth and is best enjoyed with steamed or fried buns. The pepper crab is packed with black pepper flavor and has a slight kick. Also if you don't want to get too messy they will crack your crab for you!Besides the crab, the surprise dish during this meal was the cereal prawn. It's a perfectly cooked prawn coated a thick cereal batter. The crispiness of the batter and the small chunks of green chilli give this dish a delightful sweet, spicy and crunchy flavor. Along with the great food and service, there is also outdoor seating which is nice when the weather is cool. If you have to choose one place to get some delicious crab, this is definitely the one you want to pick.

Odd place.  Kids running like wild animals with no supervision? Main course of spicy crab takes over one hour to be served.  Food is good but the other antics destroy the atmosphere.  Service poor, food good.  Best for tables of 8 or more.  Best outside or private room.

The 4 of us ordered 1 chilli crab which I thought was very good. It was not too spicy so that it went well with the Man Tau. The crab meat was nice and firm and filled the claws, indicating freshness and a high turn over. Some places the crabs have been sitting around a long time starving!The prawns cooked with salted egg yoke was good, but the dish was small. I liked the tofu cooked with broccoli and mushroom. Overall it was a very pleasant meal.

2nd visit this year, totally love it. Good food and good atmosphere. The outdoor seat is cooling but still will advice to avoid when the day are too hot.If you prefer indoor aircon seats, please make a reservation before visit. (You can use chops to make reservation as well)We ordered fried baby squid, salted eye prawns, egg fried rice, chili crab and scallop with yam ring. For me Jumbo serve the best chili crab among other major seafood chain, the sauce taste are balance and fried/steam mantou is a must eat with the chili crab sauce. Aaaaa is like heaven.

Our hotel recommended Jumbo, but I'm always a bit leery when hotels recommend since they are probably getting kick-backs of some kind.  But they checked out OK with Yelp, so we went.Atmosphere inside the restaurant wasn't much, but the drive up the street with the Christmas lights was nice!We ordered:Hong Kong-style Noodles - My daughter liked these.  I tasted them and felt like they were pretty standard, not bad but not great either.Chili Crab - I wasn't satisfied with the "chili" part of the dish.  First, wasn't very spicy, and it was too sweet and saucy for me.  And if I'm not mistaken, the sauce was ketchup-based and lacked sophistication of flavor. The crab quality was also lacking.  The texture of the crab, in some parts of the crab was off.  I had hoped that the sauce (even though it wasn't the greatest) would permeate the meat inside the crab, but I found the crab to be very unaffected by the sauce smothered on the outside.  WAY too much sauce in that dish for me!The service was pretty bad.  Nobody checking in on us, except for the very end when the meal was over.Kudos to the restaurant though for giving me the option to pay some of the bill with U.S. dollars.  I accidentally left my wallet in the hotel but luckily I had some cash in my pocket but still left me short in Singaporean dollars.  They agreed to let me pay the rest in U.S. currency.  If they refused, I would've had to take a taxi back to the hotel to fetch the $.  Very thankful that they did that for me.As for the crab part of the experience, it definitely fell short for me.  Crab House in San Francisco on Pier 39 is the winner for me.  That is the standard for whole crab.  I guess I'm spoiled.

Took the city bus with my family to try this outpost on Dempsey Hill and it was very much worth the time and effort!  A little hike up the hill from the bus stop past some other great looking restaurants including a wine bar got us ready to eat.  We were promptly seated indoors (by choice, since it was still insanely hot and humid outside) and ended up ordering a number of items, the highlights of which were their signature Chilli Crab, a perfectly cooked fish, lamb chops, and an amazing seafood fried rice.  My family (3 in all) ended up eating every bit of the 7 items we ordered, which is quite an accomplishment!The chilli crab (pictured) comes in a spicy/tangy broth and was great with their fried mantou.  While I generally don't love crab, just too much effort for too little meat, this was worth trying, and you can't really visit Singapore and not get it.  Their steamed fish was among the best I've had, and at over $100 Singaporean Dollars, it should be.  Loved the lamb chop, which was perfectly cooked, although I ended up scraping off a bit of the sauce to make it less salty.  A pitcher of Tiger Beer shared among us complemented the meal perfectly.I'm told that the Jumbo Seafood on Dempsey Hill is the best among their multiple locations in Singapore.  Minus one star for their reservations policy.  We had a Chope reservation for 8:30 and called to try to come in early to this location and other ones (Riverwalk, Riverside Place) and they told us that they were completely booked all night.  The Dempsey location was maybe 50% full the entire time we were there, so I'm not sure why they are so inflexible and unwelcoming about their reservations.  Oh well.  They were nice enough to call us a cab to take us back to the city.Overall, a great place for seafood in Singapore, and a must visit for the Chilli Crab if nothing else!

Chilli crab: 80$ for 900g of Chilli crabService: 3/5 no complaints, just that staff do what is required of them only....nothing moreTaste: given many of these crabs are flown in from Sri Lanka, I'd recommend trying this in places like Ministry of Crab or Far Crab in Sri Lanka. Preferred dining experience & taste at Ministry. Repeat: no

Jumbo's our go-to place for a good quality chilli crab.  Better order some appetizers to begin with, specially if you're a bit hungry already. Our Chilli crab came after 40mins. Our fave here - Chilli crab(of course!), fried buns, salted fish fried rice and sambal veggie.We tried something new- the crispy chix w salted egg and pumpkin sauce (see pic). I liked the sweet touch that the pumpkin added to the taste. The polite waitress taking our order and the servers added to the good lunch experience at Jumbo Dempsey.

Such a great experience. The service was fabulous. So attentive. And the food was delicious. We ordered chili crab, drunken shrimp, cod, salted egg shrimp and chicken fried rice. Everything was excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Beancurd & assorted seafood braised in claypot was pretty good. The tofu was pretty smooth, the prawn fresh & the gravy tasty.King prawn stir fried with garlic & glazed soya featured huge ass prawns - they were the King of King Prawns. The dish was excellent. The sauce was very tasty & the prawns were fresh.Half Golden Phoenix Chicken was decent. It was chicken skin with a prawn mix under it. It was somewhat springy but heavily cut with other stuff.Supreme seafood fried rice was good. There was a good wok flavour. It was not heavy on the palate.Mee goreng was decent. It was on the sweet side & not very spicy.

It is not to state the fact that Singapore has many other fabulous food choices but as the saying goes if you haven't had chili crabs you haven't been to Singapore. And what better place to enjoy such exquisite delight other than Jumbo Seafood. Ask any Singaporean and one would tell you Jumbo Seafood is synonymous with chili crabs. One should not overly indulge on the variety of other exotic and equally fantastic dishes that precedes it.  Save  some room for the mango flavored shave ice that caps the night's festivity.

This place was superb. The food options were very great as it had lots of seafood to choose. We chose the feature dish of jumbo chili crab. We ordered two type of buns: fried and steamed to dip into the chili crab sauce. We also ordered the scallops, it was great! The service was wonderful as it provided with all the tools to avoid the mess that it requires to eat crabs. The tools were: plastic cover for your belongings, plastic bag for your phone, cover for your clothes, and many more. We also ordered fried shrimps,veggies, meegoreng, and many more. It was an awesome experience!

Quite an experience and a MUST if you are visiting Singapore and have an interest in something authentic and local. The service was brisk and but attentive with a system that was ore teaming oriented - which I liked, but which sometimes caused cross services issues (drinks vs. food etc.).  But somehow it worked out and everything worked very well.  We had some game dish and then some terrific pepper steak strips.  Both relatively salty but cooked medium rare so were absolutely tasty. The crab was king of the night....  The two styles were equally good with the pepper (dark) being my favorite.  Each crab had enough meat and the sauce was deliciously tangy with a strong burn but not overwhelming.  Quite an experience. Must visit

Delicious seafood close to the city! This location is most easily reached by car, so I would suggest driving or grabbing a ride as it's situated in the heart of the Dempsey estate. It's a great place to bring out of town guests as the air conditioning and upscale decor are pleasing and comfortable, compared to its seaside location which can be tricky when it's rainy.

I like to come her for "atas" seafood. For those of you are not familiar with Singlish, atas means "high class", "boujee". I do like this location of Jumbo, its more convenient than going all the way to East Coast. There is both indoor and outdoor seating. Personally, I hate sitting outdoors because the mosquitos start feeding on me! Nothing is worst than going for dinner and leaving with lots of mosquito bites.TIP: if you mosquitos love you, and you have to sit outside, wear long pants. And spray insect repellent if needed. This is not 100% fool proof, but it will help a little, thus enabling you to enjoy your meal more.Everyone loves eating chili crab here. I personally enjoy eating black pepper crab here. It is quite spicy! Be prepared to get your hands all dirty- but that is part of the experience! Don't worry, there are finger bowls as well as bathrooms for you to wash your hands.The food here is excellent. Some of the usual dishes I like to order are:-sambal kang kong-Hong Kong style steamed soon hok -Deep fried yam with scallop-Fried Rice and Fried Hor Fun Overall, a great place for seafood!

Visited this restaurant twice. Love the traditional chili crab here. Juicy, tender and flavourful. Best paired with warm bread rolls to soak up the crab. The fried rice, fried mini squids, and cold jellyfish were also delicious. Made bookings ahead of time and there was quite a queue outside for no bookings. Toilets could be cleaner.

On a nice breezy night, this is a great Jumbo outlet to have dinner at.Jumbo remains my go-to for chilli crab, and I'm glad I was able to take my mother here to finally show her the wonderfulness that is Singapore chilli crab.Unfortunately they ran out of live prawn when we visited so the drunken prawn was unavailable. We ordered the cereal prawn instead and it didn't disappoint!In addition to the normal chilli crab and fried buns, we also got their seafood fried rice. Delicious as usual.Definitely make a reservation for dinner or weekends as far in advance as possible, as this place books very easily.

I've been meaning to write a review for this place...on my recent trip to Singapore..everyone suggested to try this place. It's the best and biggest crab ever!!! I also loveeee the duck salad...I was one happy girl!

I came by the recommendation of a friend. The service of this restaurant is super, staff are so friendly, and attentive. The foods taste good, and comes quick, if you like seafoods, this is the place, but only when you do not mind spending big $$$.  Their price is insane. for a lobster, I was charged 190 Singapore yuan.  For a meal for two, we spent over 400 Singapore yuan for only 2-3 dishes. definitely will not go back to this place.

Out of all the Jumbo branches in Singapore this one in Dempsey is hands down my favorite. The food simply tasted better than any other place and the service is far superior; you get your food quick and the service was very friendly. It is tough picking between the two flavors, but for me the chilli crab slightly edges out the black pepper crab. Fortunately I've had enough people in my party to try both. The chilli crab has a nice balance of sweet and spicy flavor. It comes in a rich, delicious eggy broth and is best enjoyed with steamed or fried buns. The pepper crab is packed with black pepper flavor and has a slight kick. Also if you don't want to get too messy they will crack your crab for you!Besides the crab, the surprise dish during this meal was the cereal prawn. It's a perfectly cooked prawn coated a thick cereal batter. The crispiness of the batter and the small chunks of green chilli give this dish a delightful sweet, spicy and crunchy flavor. Along with the great food and service, there is also outdoor seating which is nice when the weather is cool. If you have to choose one place to get some delicious crab, this is definitely the one you want to pick.

Odd place.  Kids running like wild animals with no supervision? Main course of spicy crab takes over one hour to be served.  Food is good but the other antics destroy the atmosphere.  Service poor, food good.  Best for tables of 8 or more.  Best outside or private room.

The 4 of us ordered 1 chilli crab which I thought was very good. It was not too spicy so that it went well with the Man Tau. The crab meat was nice and firm and filled the claws, indicating freshness and a high turn over. Some places the crabs have been sitting around a long time starving!The prawns cooked with salted egg yoke was good, but the dish was small. I liked the tofu cooked with broccoli and mushroom. Overall it was a very pleasant meal.

2nd visit this year, totally love it. Good food and good atmosphere. The outdoor seat is cooling but still will advice to avoid when the day are too hot.If you prefer indoor aircon seats, please make a reservation before visit. (You can use chops to make reservation as well)We ordered fried baby squid, salted eye prawns, egg fried rice, chili crab and scallop with yam ring. For me Jumbo serve the best chili crab among other major seafood chain, the sauce taste are balance and fried/steam mantou is a must eat with the chili crab sauce. Aaaaa is like heaven.

Our hotel recommended Jumbo, but I'm always a bit leery when hotels recommend since they are probably getting kick-backs of some kind.  But they checked out OK with Yelp, so we went.Atmosphere inside the restaurant wasn't much, but the drive up the street with the Christmas lights was nice!We ordered:Hong Kong-style Noodles - My daughter liked these.  I tasted them and felt like they were pretty standard, not bad but not great either.Chili Crab - I wasn't satisfied with the "chili" part of the dish.  First, wasn't very spicy, and it was too sweet and saucy for me.  And if I'm not mistaken, the sauce was ketchup-based and lacked sophistication of flavor. The crab quality was also lacking.  The texture of the crab, in some parts of the crab was off.  I had hoped that the sauce (even though it wasn't the greatest) would permeate the meat inside the crab, but I found the crab to be very unaffected by the sauce smothered on the outside.  WAY too much sauce in that dish for me!The service was pretty bad.  Nobody checking in on us, except for the very end when the meal was over.Kudos to the restaurant though for giving me the option to pay some of the bill with U.S. dollars.  I accidentally left my wallet in the hotel but luckily I had some cash in my pocket but still left me short in Singaporean dollars.  They agreed to let me pay the rest in U.S. currency.  If they refused, I would've had to take a taxi back to the hotel to fetch the $.  Very thankful that they did that for me.As for the crab part of the experience, it definitely fell short for me.  Crab House in San Francisco on Pier 39 is the winner for me.  That is the standard for whole crab.  I guess I'm spoiled.

Took the city bus with my family to try this outpost on Dempsey Hill and it was very much worth the time and effort!  A little hike up the hill from the bus stop past some other great looking restaurants including a wine bar got us ready to eat.  We were promptly seated indoors (by choice, since it was still insanely hot and humid outside) and ended up ordering a number of items, the highlights of which were their signature Chilli Crab, a perfectly cooked fish, lamb chops, and an amazing seafood fried rice.  My family (3 in all) ended up eating every bit of the 7 items we ordered, which is quite an accomplishment!The chilli crab (pictured) comes in a spicy/tangy broth and was great with their fried mantou.  While I generally don't love crab, just too much effort for too little meat, this was worth trying, and you can't really visit Singapore and not get it.  Their steamed fish was among the best I've had, and at over $100 Singaporean Dollars, it should be.  Loved the lamb chop, which was perfectly cooked, although I ended up scraping off a bit of the sauce to make it less salty.  A pitcher of Tiger Beer shared among us complemented the meal perfectly.I'm told that the Jumbo Seafood on Dempsey Hill is the best among their multiple locations in Singapore.  Minus one star for their reservations policy.  We had a Chope reservation for 8:30 and called to try to come in early to this location and other ones (Riverwalk, Riverside Place) and they told us that they were completely booked all night.  The Dempsey location was maybe 50% full the entire time we were there, so I'm not sure why they are so inflexible and unwelcoming about their reservations.  Oh well.  They were nice enough to call us a cab to take us back to the city.Overall, a great place for seafood in Singapore, and a must visit for the Chilli Crab if nothing else!

Chilli crab: 80$ for 900g of Chilli crabService: 3/5 no complaints, just that staff do what is required of them only....nothing moreTaste: given many of these crabs are flown in from Sri Lanka, I'd recommend trying this in places like Ministry of Crab or Far Crab in Sri Lanka. Preferred dining experience & taste at Ministry. Repeat: no

Jumbo's our go-to place for a good quality chilli crab.  Better order some appetizers to begin with, specially if you're a bit hungry already. Our Chilli crab came after 40mins. Our fave here - Chilli crab(of course!), fried buns, salted fish fried rice and sambal veggie.We tried something new- the crispy chix w salted egg and pumpkin sauce (see pic). I liked the sweet touch that the pumpkin added to the taste. The polite waitress taking our order and the servers added to the good lunch experience at Jumbo Dempsey.

Such a great experience. The service was fabulous. So attentive. And the food was delicious. We ordered chili crab, drunken shrimp, cod, salted egg shrimp and chicken fried rice. Everything was excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Out of the branches, the outdoor seating in Jumbo Dempsey is beautiful. Brought a friend visiting Singapore few weeks ago and we couldn't have asked for a better atmosphere/seating. With guests, D and I always get:-the award winning Chilli crab/black pepper crab + dozen (or more) bread-Deshelled prawn with salad cream in golden nest, or deshelled wasabi prawn. -Scallop wrapped in Yam Ring-Steamed bamboo clam with minced garlic and some fried ricetook off one star bc while the waiters were generally honest at this branch, the chilli crab came with basically no chilli. We were done after dipping our breads into it for a bit. Usually, there is so much chilli leftover that I end up taking it away and eating it with rice next day for lunch. Disappointing, but the great atmosphere and the other dishes made up for it. Make sure to make reservations early! for visitors, i also recommend No Signboard in Esplanade bc of the beautiful view of marina bay sands and raffles place, though you have to keep alert NOT to get ripped off by the greedy waiters.

We had 11 people, so we got a private room. The food was very good but expensive. It seems like it caters to tourists. It was fun to eat family style as it allowed us to try a lot of different items. Good food but expensive and they charge you for everything including the peanuts and wet wipes for after you have eaten the crab. Go to Chinatown for great food at a much lower cost.

Apparently this is the place to go for Singapore's famous chili crab. Came here for a team dinner while in Singapore and work had rented out the private room. If you come here on your own terms, be prepared for pretty steep prices. It was a really good experience but I deducted one star because they have shark fin on the menu and the service was a little lackluster and slow. The salted egg crab (coated in a rich layer of salted egg yolk) was my least favorite. I definitely enjoyed the chili crab (not really spicy at all) but actually found the black pepper crab more interesting in flavor. From the huge choice of appetizers, the scallops and the dragon fruit with lobster stood out the most.  Word of advice: don't wear a white shirt or any piece of clothing you care about. This affair is messier than your average Maryland  crab feast.
My first time trying chilli crab and it was amazing!The restaurant was very clean and modern, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious. I will definitely be back for more.

Chilli crab!!! My brother is a huge aficionado and avers that they have the best. Also, bf's family friend also swears by the chilli crab at this particular outlet of Jumbo Seafood, apparently. Although, I have to say, Forture Seafood along Bkt Timah Rd does a pretty gd rendition (and their mantous are to die for, really) for cheaper. Not as nice ambience there though.Soon hock in soy sauce was fresh and delicious!Spinach beancurd with spinach/three types of mushrooms (enoki/shimeji/shiitake, I think) was delicious too!Roast chicken, mm.Black pepper venison, very tender!Kai lan in garlic, normal.HK mee, pretty gd too! Nice al dente/bite to the noodles, crunchy prawn, shredded cabbage and bean sprouts.Yam paste dessert and mango pudding were pretty gd!Can't comment on prices as this was a treat. But Jumbo card holders get 20% off ala carte and 10% off set menus. They also sell the chilli crab paste should you wish to try making your own chilli crab at home!

It's our first time eating chili crab in Singapore. We ordered the warm king crab leg appetizer, fried rice and chili crab. The chili crab came in at almost 2 lbs, which was too much for us. The flavor was good,  but a bit too sweet, and not spicy enough. The king crab appetizer was really good. Fried rice was also really good. I think I may try another chili crab place next time, for something a bit more spicy and less sweet.

The only place to go to try the chili and black pepper crab. We opted to sit outside and the weather was perfect for our enjoyable dinner. I am a huge seafood lover so this just hit the spot for what my palate was craving. I believe I prefer the chili crab over the black pepper, but it was a very close tie. Enjoyable experience and atmosphere!
This is one of the best sea food experience I hadHighly recommend their Black Pepper Crab and Coffee Ribs

jumbo is consistently good. their food is always tasty and well prepared, although probably not the best. their chilli crab and pepper crab are both excellent. the pepper crab is very peppery which i love. the chilli crab sauce is fantastic and such a great pairing with their mantous. i had the cereal prawns this time, and got them without the shell because i'm lazy. unfortunately they just didn't taste that great. not sure if it was this particular jumbo, or if it was because of the lack of shell. i love the razor clams dish, but they were out the time i came here.drunken prawns are also excellent.

If this was a normal dining experience, I'd really rate JUMBO Seafood at Dempsey only three stars. BUT. As a JUMBO privilege card member, I got 20% off our a la carte orders, AND 50% off the fresh crabs. Yes, you read that right. HALF PRICE off the Chili crab and Pepper and Spiced Salt crab that we ordered. So for that awesome value, I'm adding a star. Dinner was a pretty last minute decision; we only realised that the voucher for 50% off crabs was only valid for April on the 29th of April... so at 8pm we frantically tried calling the Dempsey branch because it was the most central for all of us. As expected of a busy restaurant there was no answer... so we went online and Chope-d our seats. SCORE.Got there, and as we ordered, we were a little disappointed. They'd run out of a few drinks, and didn't have anymore pork ribs. So we ordered two crabs, their scallops wrapped in yam, black-pepper venison, baby kai lan fried with garlic and mantou.I won't talk about the crabs, since everyone does, but I highly recommend the scallops wrapped in yam. The yam is light, crispy, and sweet. While a little overpowering for the scallops, they're still very enjoyable and actually quite addictive. The black-pepper venison was also a pleasant surprise. The black pepper sauce was incredibly rich, fragrant, and really stole the show. We were mopping it up with the mantou instead of using it on the Chili crab. It was THAT GOOD!So all that food, with some drinks... at $50 a head? I MEAN COME ON! That's definitely worth one star right there. I'm just looking forward to the 50% off fresh lobster month. :D
Excellent pepper crab! The price is cheaper than in Hong Kong. Razor clams are also very very good!!! The drinks are probably the weakest part, the lychee soda tastes quite artificial.
Love the atmosphere. Staff was friendly and courteous. We had the chili crab, deep fried squid, buns and oatmeal prawns. The crab and prawns were a bit too sweet, but scrumptious, regardless.
The Outback Steakhouse of Singaporian Seafood. Heavily sauced.... The foods, not me. Overrated.

Walked here post-drinks@WhiteRabbit down the hill. 3 of us had the signature chilli crabs, 2 baskets of fried mantaus and kailan cooked w garlic. Everything was tasty but my fav crabs (in this type of setting) is still Malaysia's FattyCrab in PJ. Extra star is for the airy patio seating.

I've never seen chilli crab advertised so aggressively! Ask any local about Jumbo Seafood and the association with chilli crab comes to mind. Besides chilli crabs, Jumbo does serve up a decent black pepper and salted egg version. Order a side of chinese buns to go with your crab instead of rice! Located in Dempsey, this is a great place to enjoy a taste of local flavor before heading off to any wine bar in the vicinity to enjoy a relaxing glass of wine under the lush greenery and foliage.

Jumbo Seafood at Dempsey is a great family restaurant. The seafood is always fresh and well cooked. I've been here several times, all reasonably satisfying experience. The service is prompt but not on the polite-side. The staff are mostly Chinese-speaking and do not understand a lot of English, which for some, myself included, makes it very difficult to give a simple order.The interior is nothing great, following their corporate colours, and themes. If you've been to one, they're just about the same as the rest without a hint of uniqueness. Jumbo about the biggest player in Singapore's seafood market, just about every local has been there! They've definitely built a big name for themselves, and for that they have my respect.Generally a place for family or co-workers, it is a great place for a reunion and even a company dinner.Mon - Sat, 12:00 pm - 9:00 pmSunday, Closed

Both the chili crab and pepper crab were extremely good- neither were very 'different' from other places I've been in Singapore- but in this case the lack of 'special touch' was welcomed. Just straight forward, Singapore style/quality crab.We had the crispy baby squid heads, which when coupled with beer, were fishy-squidy-amazing. We dipped them in the sweet chili garlic sauce (pretty sure that was a faux pas but do not care) which made them even better.The bun situation kind of bugged me though- the buns were on the small side and didn't come with the chili crab. Weird.Dempsey is ideal in that if you didn't make a reservation and had to wait, there are pubs/breweries in short walking distance to pass time.

Nice food, but a few items were not available.  You definitely need a reservation and basically full every night.  Black pepper crab probably best in town and prices are reasonable if you have the Jumbo privilege card.

Jumbo Seagood is one of the stalwarts of seafood dining in Singapore. It is famous for its chili crabs - the gravy is thick and luscious. Order a side of fried mantous (little buns) to dip into the gravy, and you're guaranteed to leave feeling satisfied! Other dishes which are good include the ever ubiquitous cereal prawns and black pepper crabs. The Dempsey outlet in particular has a rather nice atmosphere. It has a decidedly more upmarket feel than the other Jumbo outlets - this could also be due to the fact that it's one of the newer stores. Bring your tourist friends to Jumbo for a seafood dinner, and I'm pretty sure they'll have a good impression of Singapore (:

Fantastic place! I was initially intimidated by the tapas, because I was dining alone. But was pleased to find that their serving is just right. I had the Oyster Escabeche, Strawberry gazpacho with king crab, Jamon Iberico on tomato bread, Carabinero carpaccio, cod 'Brandada' and Spanish omelette.Quite a handful for a lone diner. I would say of all the dishes I've had, the Carabinero carpaccio was the most remarkable. I've never had prawn carpaccio before. It tasted really fresh and crunchy, with a taste of the sea. Most of the dishes just kept me smiling while I ate it, as it really reminds me of what I've have in Spain.Overall, a great restaurant with a wide selection of dishes and great service. Definitely will return again!

There are few culinary pleasures more fulfilling than the the crunchy charred socarrat of an expertly prepared paella.  Paired with the chewy, flavorful rice and iced with a decadent dab of garlic aioli, you have in your mightily little spoon an invincible bite.  Sadly, it was the very lack of socarrat in La Ventana's famous, pricey ($39) and rather puny pigeon paella that left me most underwhelmed by the restaurant.  Despite the disappointing paella, there are several things the restaurant does right.  For starters, the ambiance is beautiful with a garden setting and bright airy decor, perfect for a ladies lunch out.  The service was attentive, if not exactly friendly.  We also enjoyed the tapas including the Canelon Since 1869 ($12/piece) stuffed with foie gras and ground meat smothered in truffle cream sauce, the bunelos (cod fritters), and the croquettes, both the chicken and the ham.PARTING THOUGHT: overall, without alcohol or desserts, the lunch was $137 for two, which we felt was a bit stiff given the quantity of food and the disappointing paella...

My friend and I dined here on a weekday dinner and opted to go a la carte instead of trying the tapas tasting menu.  The ambiance was very nice and we were seated outdoors on a pleasant night with good service.Food was solidly delicious but definitely not mind-blowing.  It is on the higher end of prices but expectedly so in Singapore, especially if it is accompanied by wine.  I'd recommend the Patatas Bravas, Jamón Ibérico "de Bellota", Lobster "Coca", Canelon since 1869 and Catalan Creme Brulee.  Other things we tried were the Croquetas and Chicken Wing Confit.
Great drinks and delicious tapas.  The outdoor patio is a great spot to relax with a glass of sangria.  Wait staff are super friendly.

Awesome food! Awesome service! Our waitress from Spain was incredible. I wished I had gotten her name. This place had lovely ambience and the patatas bravas is elegantly laid out and delicioso! Even grilled veges tasted amazing and the paella was tasty. The Creme Brûlée is an absolute must! Only let down was the mojito dessert. Overall, really enjoyed  the food!!!

The classic Catalan cuisine was pretty great, if a little stodgy. There were a couple of memorable hits, but many were tame, as traditional fare is wont to be. That said, for a bill that just hit the $100 mark for 6 dishes, La Ventana could possibly be the cheapest Michelin-related restaurant ever.We had:1) Chicken Wing Confit ($14): conveniently boneless, and a lovely showpiece of slow-cooked succulence blanketed in a lightly spiced jus. Nice, but a little forgettable.2) Ditto for the Surf & Turf ($18), juicy fat beef meatballs and baby calamari dunked in a well-rounded tomato-based sauce. We thought it a particularly thoughtful gesture to split them up into 2 portions for us.3) Croquetas ($14):with roasted chicken, the highlight, and insanely good...I'm still dreaming about these babies.4) Miniature Tortillas ($12): may have appeared drab, but turned out simplicity at its finest, delicious and wonderfully nuanced.5) Cod Bunuelos ($18) fritters of mashed Atlantic cod: so well done I hardly noticed the parsley specks weaved into it. I actually thought the parsley balanced out the fattiness of the cod, rather than detracted from it. 6) Fiduea ($32) a Catalan-style noodle paella simmered in a rich seafood stock and aioli: we had differing opinions on this - it may have been a smidge oily and overwhelming with the taste of octopus, but it wasn't as hateful as the Hubs feltPictures are at thehungrybunnie.blogspot…
Delicious food but a bit pricey even compared to other tapas places. The outdoor seating area is absolutely gorgeous.

Dempsey has an awesome vibe and Red Dot contributes nicely to it. They have large outdoor seating area (big fan) and great collection of locally brewed beers. Definitely try the green one: I normally would not go for colored or flavored beer - but this one tastes like your normal lager - and looks special. Food (mostly ang moh fare) is good and compliments the beer nicely. Friendly staff.

The beers were decent, cocktails were excellent, but the highlight of my experience here was Andrew the bartender. I sat at the bar and had a wonderful time chatting with him. He was friendly, very knowledgeable about beer and cocktails, and went out of his way to ensure I had a good experience. As a beer nerd and home brewer, it makes me happy when the staff know so much about their in house beer. I highly recommend sitting at the bar with Andrew if you enjoy good conversation, and I look forward to my next visit.

This location is easier to access if you have a car or you take a cab but doable if you take public transportation like we did. We came for drinks and appetizer only as a pre game. Beers were cold and fries were hot. Ambience was great-we sat outdoors at the smoking section and it had a nice big fan blowing to keep us cool.

Pretty Christmas decorations that welcome us on our way up the stairs. Even the chairs get dressed up with Santa hats!Great selection of Beer (try the Green Monster Beer!), Great Band, Great Ambience (but it can get a little loud at times when they raise the volume of the music). Great place to celebrate friend's birthday, you can order dessert and get the staff to personalize the plate with the word "Happy Birthday", you can also dedicate birthday song via the band.

It is ok. It is a microbrewery. The fun beer is the green monster which looks luminously green but tastes like a normal beer.I find the beers here just ok, noting to rave about. Never tried any food here before.The place is nice for a quiet chill with friends as it is big, great for groups, nice on a balmy evening when it is not too humid. And yeah, free parking too!

This is a review of a short stop at RedDot Brewhouse for a industry related event.i recently attended a work event here.  There were about 20 of us,   We took up two tables.The staff was very friendly and attentive.  They were constantly there pouring beers and insuring orders were taken.I like the indoor/outdoor feel of the space.  It is very airy.  The place has a very relaxed mood.tinyurl.com/agh94vkThe beer was decent but doesn't really rank with amazing micro-brews.I would certainly consider to RedDot again.  I think it is a good spot for groups.
Ehhhh. Food was not great and not a lot of vegetarian options. The green beer is fun and light!

A nice bar with an alfresco vibe. There was a live band playing really chilled out tunes which set a beautiful relaxed atmosphere under the stars. RedDot brews their own brand of beers, with a taste test available so do test out before you get it, as we were recommended a sweet beer with passion fruit notes, but after tasting I was thankful I didn't get stuck with it in the end. One unfortunate thing that happened, as we were sitting beneath the trees, some gross unidentifiable semi-liquid stuff fell on my friend which kind of dampened the experience there, but this is probably and hopefully an unfortunate isolated case.

Much like the bigger red dot we're all living on, how much you like Reddot Brewhouse really depends on what you're expecting and what you're looking for.Don't expect: amazing fancy complex beers, or excellent service, or delicious satisfying mains.The service in particular, can be absolutely atrocious on some days.  Nope. Don't expect any of that.Instead, expect what you'd expect of a casual pub with a good band.Affordable, good (but not amazing) beer. Some interesting brews, and generally it all goes down easy.Great bar snacks and finger food. Their spicy wings pack a REAL KICK so don't go in cocky. The wedges and other snacks and eats are all perfectly decent. Nothing inedible, nothing gross. I found their Vongole HORRIBLE though, so I'd definitely give that a miss. Previous experiences have established that their other mains are also 'just decent', so generally I recommend eating dinner somewhere else first (and there are so, so many options in the Dempsey area so there's no excuse) and then going to chill out and have beers at Reddot after.The live bands they bring in are alright too. While not always the best singers in the place, they always work hard to engage the crowd, have little gameshow type things, (we won a free beer tower!), and generally really help up the fun factor.So like I said at the start. Don't go to Reddot looking to be disappointed. Go with low expectations, a high threshold for beer, and with friends you want to laugh with. That's the secret sauce.

I've been coming here for about 4 years, mainly for the beers and the outdoor setting. Staff are attentive and the beers are fine with a wide variety. But last Friday, 3 of us met there around 6:30pm. We sat outside near the water feature...I hadn't been back in about 6 months. I noticed how old and tired the place was looking. Nothing has changed outside in 3 years. If anything, service to the outdoor area has gone backwards since the closure of the outside serving station. Beers came in a good order from the inside bar, but the pizzas took an eternity from the kitchen. The Parma ham pizza was passable, but the meat lovers pizza was epically horrible...cardboard base with tomato sauce, topped with ground beef and BBQ sauce drizzled on top with unidentifiable cheese globbed here and there. A sicky sweet awful conglomeration...No pepperoni, no salami, no onions, no herbs...nothing. Avoid eating pizzas here at all costs. And please, spend some money on the outdoor area. Would have given just 1 star for the beers, but credit to staff that the toilets are clean and well serviced.

Went here for dinner early on a Saturday evening. Our party of 4 didn't have a reservation, but luckily we were able to get seated right away.The menu has a good variety of pub grub and pastas, with average prices for Dempsey Hill. I wanted to order a pizza but apparently it wasn't available. I think the waitress mentioned something about pizzas only being served later in the evening? Either way, I was peeved about that, so I ended up not ordering. My husband ordered a seafood pasta of sorts and it was alright, nothing to Yelp about. Our friend's date got the fish and chips, and it also looked decent.However, the service was good, as the place was packed but I don't remember any long waits. Also, they were nice enough to let us move to the smoking area on the patio after the staff dried everything off (I don't know why they weren't prepared for the daily rainstorms we have!)What I really enjoyed was the live music. The first act of the evening was pretty good, 2 guys doing an acoustic act, singing an alternative music set. However, I really liked the second act- a man and woman who just sang with a keyboard. They sounded amazing! Loved their focus on top 40 hits.Overall, not a place to go out of your way for, but good spot for casually hanging out with friends or starting the night out. Also, the only place I know where you can have green beer year round, as opposed to only on St. Paddy's day. :)
We tucked in for one drink and enjoyed the flavor. The bartender was really friendly. The area is way too touristy for me and I don't think I'd like to eat here but it wasn't bad for grabbing a pint.
Good location,  great selection of microbrew beers, very decent food for a brew house, good place to chill with friends, can get noisy but you are at a brew house after all.

Good beer........the extra star is for the beer, otherwise my rating would be TWO stars.  You can order a sampler set and taste the different beers before ordering a pint.  I was surprised with the lime wheat, very tasty and refreshing.  Food was edible and not memorable.  A bit overpriced for what you were getting.  Ordered the Baby Chili Squid, over cooked and basically eating crumbs of breading, did not eat.  Also ordered fish and chips, chips were good and dusted with a lovely seasoning and fish was okay.  Now for the service.  Seated by the hostess who did not appear to like her job.  She took our initial drink order and later our food order, 15 minutes later.  The food was served in a timely manner.  However, the service not so great.  When I was in need malt vinager and condiments, I had to flag some one down and each attempt was ignored by wait staff.  When I finally got the hostess' attention, I made my request, but again had to wait, in the mean time my food is becoming cold.  She finally  brought a sweet balsamic vinagerette dressing.  When I commented on the balasmic vinagrette dress I was served, the hostess responded rudely, "You asked for vinager and this is what we have."  After making a second request for vinager to a second waitress who promptly and apologetically brought me white wine vinager, which at this point I gave up asking.  Who serves fish & chips and does NOT have malt vinager?  Attempts at getting the wait staff attention is very difficult.   Make sure you make all your requests before they leave your table.GOOD beerOKAY food - a bit overpriced HORRENDOUS service - so far the worst service
