While my friend and I walked out of the store, the servers bowed down their heads and thanked us. Why there's a minus one here is due to the pricing and it had too much vegetable in the pizza. Otherwise, it's good. Will try other foods there in the future.

address: 68 Orchard Road #03-79/83, Plaza Singapure Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: Love their pizza! As their name suggest, The pizza is skinny in terms of dough. There's very little dough and you feel like you were eating some biscuit or nachos. Great for people like me who ain't big fans of pizza doughs. We ordered the squid ink pizza which was fabulous. The English Breakfast pizza was not that great though.There were five of us and we woof down the two pizza really quickly. The pizza portions are fairly small, I suspect we were able to consume another two more pizza if not for the limited time we had. Was surprised that they were rather empty during lunch and service was rather slow too.Will definitely be back for more skinny pizza!

address: 68 Orchard Road #03-79/83, Plaza Singapure Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: From most favorite to least1. Squid ink pizza  - Da best! Crispy pizza base with fresh squid toppings. Instead of the usual thick tomato based pizza sauce, Skinny uses a nice savory-sweet sauce (mayo? unsure but it sure taste awesome). 2. Chicken sausage (spicy) - Not bad. I am not much of a sausage fan. 3. Corn (with cream cheese) - Some parts of the corn was under cooked, making it though to bite. The corn was dry and not as juicy. However, the cream cheese topping was great :) who knew cream-cheese went well with corn? 4. Sweet potato nibblets - Pass on this dish! it was disappointing. The wedges are too thick and dry. The fries turned soggy after awhile. Definitely do not expect american style sweet potato fries. Skinny has much to learn from the yankies. Overall: Will come back for the pizza again. Nothing else excites me much.

address: 68 Orchard Road #03-79/83, Plaza Singapure Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: This newly opened shop at the Plaza Singapura extension is right smack in the middle of the extension so it is quite easy to find. This was my second time eating at Skinny Pizza and it was incited by seeing so much foodporn regarding this place on food blogs as well as instagram.Knowing that the pizza was quite a big serving for just one person alone, my 2 friends and I decided to order 2 pizzas as well as the truffle fries to share amongst us and it was indeed a good decision on our part. We ordered Skinny Pizza's specialty- Squid Ink pizza. The pizza could definitely do with slightly more sauce to make it more flavorful as well as to reduce the dryness of the pizza. Nonetheless, the squid on the pizza did help to save the pizza's reputation.We also ordered the English Breakfast pizza which looks like the second most appetizing pizza on the menu. This pizza was pretty good. The tomatoes on this pizza was really huge, juicy and tasty and weirdly enough, it was the highlight of this pizza for me. The truffle fries didn't particularly suit my taste buds, perhaps it may be because I was not used to not having my fries taste salty instead of bitter. The fries reminded me of wasabi fries and for $7, I don't think its worth it as I ended up drowning the taste in chilli sauce.The bill surmounted to $66 which means we spent $22 per person. The cakes at Skinny Pizza looked really sumptuous however, by then we were already too full for dessert. The pasta also seemed scrumptious but while looking around, it did not seem to be a popular choice amongst customers.On a side note, the service at this outlet is highly commendable. The staff crew was very enthusiastic and polite, constantly asking us if we would like a refill and everyone of them also bidded my friends and I goodbye when we exited the shop.

address: 68 Orchard Road #03-79/83, Plaza Singapure Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: I recently tried the anchovy pesto pizza and it was helluva good, if you like a light garlicky pizza with cheery tomatoes and a little briny flavor (yum!). But whatever you do, DO NOT get the pepper tomato soup. I couldn't bring myself to take even two sips of that thing. It's spicy in a horrid way, and tastes like dilute sweet chili sauce. Yuck yuck yuck!

address: 68 Orchard Road #03-79/83, Plaza Singapure Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: I miss this new concept in Singapore!  Skinny Pizza was a quick growing casual pizza chain that specialized in gourmet pizzas served on wafer thing cracker crusts!  Great eclectic menu and probably some of the best casual service in Singapore!  I hope they come to the U.S.!  One of the chains I miss from Singapore (as it was only a few minutes walk from where I lived).

Good decent burgers, as a Californian gal, these burgers are very filling - with good fries to boot!Had no idea what bun they used but it was super soft!!Pretty good, with really good fries and a good selection of burgers makes it like I almost never left home!

Even though Fat Boys has been around in Singapore for quite a while, I've never been to one. But one weekday night I decided to give it a go. They offer western comfort food, like greasy burgers, artery clogging mac and cheese, chili cheese fries, milk shakes etc.They also offer customization of burgers, so you get to pick your veg, meat, egg, sauces and even buns. You could pretty much create a mega upsized burger with all forms of protein and dairy products, as long as your wallet was okay with it.Most burgers are priced around $13-$18++, you can top up $2.50++ for truffle Parmesan fries or chili cheese fries. Just top up and you won't regret it. Totally worth the extra time in the gym and money!So here was our feast for 3 pax, 2 hungry adult males and I! It was way too much food. I could sense food coma approaching as I looked at the table!1. Shrooms Burger $13++ + $2.50 for chili cheese frieslove mushrooms and the mushrooms here were quite generous. The burger bun was fluffy and slighly crispy on the edges, but as time went by, it became a soggy burger bun. The onions weren't very flavourful but rather, they were quite oily. Nonetheless, the onions brought out the flavour of the juicy mushrooms.I loved the melted cheese. It was perfect for the thick beef patty. I really liked this combination and for the price. I felt that it was pretty decent. The chili fries weren't as good as I had remembered. But the fries were crisp all the way.2. DIY Burger + $2.50 for truffle friesAt Fay Boys you get to customize your burger. For this baby, we haveHoney Oat bun $2 with1. Beef Patty $92. Bacon $2.503. Sauteed Shitake Mushroom $24. Swiss Cheese $1.805. Fried Egg $1.506. Fried Onion Rings $1.507. Garlic Aioli $0.80Total $21.10++It is a pretty pricey burger but it has everything that I want on a burger, no veggies! The burger came pretty quickly and sadly I didn't get the honour of bursting the runny egg yolk. The garlic aioli sauce was addictive and it really gave everything in the burger the same flavour.3. Chicken waffle sandwich $15.50++Another sinful main course, chicken cutlet sandwiched between cheese underneath a buttermilk waffle. The chicken cutlet was pretty thin despite it's length, but it was crispy and breaded. The waffle was quite tasteless despite it's colour. The mash potatoes were strangely cold but tasty.4. Onion RingsI loved these onion rings mainly due to the batter they used. It was fragrant and very crispy. It wasn't doughy at all. The onion rings were huge in diameter and they tasted great with the bbq sauce.5. CalamariThe calamari was abit too chewy for my liking. But the wasabi mayo was it's saving grace. Definitely preferred the onion rings over the calamari.Overall : Decent burgers with quick and friendly service. Just skip the sides.
Nice burger joint in Singapore with good burgers and a good ambience. I had thir cheeseburger with fries. The bun was slightly crispy and the patty was very juicy. Recommend to give this place a try!

The place is quite nice and comfy.I took a Cheeseburger which had a decent size and was tasty (meat a bit over cooked but it was still good). For the fries,  unfortunately it's frozen fries (and you can taste it) and the sizing is small :/

For some reason this outlet doesn't exist on the Internet at the moment. It's not on their official website yet, and it's not even listed on the name card that the cashier gave me! Did I eat here in a dream...??Regardless of whether or not I dined here in a parallel universe, this Dhoby Ghaut outlet is pretty sweet, as it's a 5 minute walk from the MRT/Plaza Sing. Walking in, I felt like I was in a cooler version of a Johnny Rockets (after all, their playlist included fun hits like Grease Lightning.) After skimming the menu, I went with my gut and my love for the movie Pulp Fiction by ordering the Royale with Cheese. I'm not sure if I'm biased because I had only eaten 3 rice cakes earlier that day but MAN that burger was good! I asked for it to be medium, and although it was a bit too red in the centre for me, it was quite delicious and I didn't get sick from it. The fries that it came with were good, but not life changing.This is the perfect casual spot to meet friends, watch the game, and, hey, it's air conditioned. I'd be more than happy to return!
The burger is good but the one I tried (royal cheese) had too much bbq sauce that was too sweet.Meat and bun were good so I need to try something else next time. 3-stars for now

Their cordon bleu burger is so awsome. The resturant offers German beers, a vierity of Western food, and oldies music. The decoration is 50's diner style.I wanted to add a photo of my burger. I am not sure how.

This is my first time here and I'm absolutely excited. The place is really nice and the burger smells really good. I ordered the fat basterd and it was amazing! The taste was fabulous and serving was huge. I am really delighted I found this place as its gonna be one of my favorite place to go.

Wanted to love this place after seeing the menu in the window.  The two of us returned on a Thursday evening October 9th around 8:30pm.  Every seat was taken in this small dining room.  We waited in the queue outside.  After a short wait we were invited in.The staff member showed us to a 4 top in the back of the restuarant.  After we were seated we were asked to move to a very small 2 top back in a narrow hallway.The original 4 top remained unfilled during our whole dining visit.  We were treated to the constant flow of servers rushing by our tableWe placed our order and asked for water for the table as  neither one of us are bar drinkers.  We were told that the water canteen was out front.  It truly was , just left of the front entrance door.   I weaved and dodged my way through service staff and customers to arrive at the water station.  There stacked were the smallest red plastic glasses I had ever seen.  I filled two and proceeded to walk to the back of this place dodging the same crowd as before. i WILL CALL THIS THE WATER WALK OF SHAME.  PUNISHMENT FOR ORDERING A NON CHARGABLE BEVERAGE.The food took some time to arrive to our table and that is understandible  as they were busy.  I ordered a black pepper and blue cheese burger and my dining companion ordered the Holy Ceaser Chicken.The burger was coated in way too much black pepper. The Chicken Ceaser was okay.  There is a sign at the front that says if you don't like our burgers go to the clown next door.  I can think of alot of places in Singapore to get a GREAT burger and food at this price point.  I will take their  advice and go revisit one of my other favorites.The best thing going for this place is there is no service charge.  I suspect that is what packs them in.

The only reason why I visited this store in the first place was because of a voucher. But once I tried it, I became a fan instantly. Since we visited on a weekday afternoon, the entire restaurant was basically empty and we had the luxury to sit in front of the teppanyaki area. The show of skills alone was already impressive, watching him slice up the meat and vegetables so quickly yet precisely. The most important thing was the fact that he could control the timing and heat of it, so that the met retained its flavour and juiciness. Each piece of beef was equally tender and juicy, bursting with flavour but not too salty. The sauce was delicious when mixed with the bowl of Japanese rice we were served with. The tofu that came with the set was also worthy of praise, with the silky texture and thick savoury sauce. Service was also excellent as it should be, seeing that they only had one table to attend to.  The chef also made it a point to make small talk when he was preparing the food, which I felt was a nice touch. Otherwise it could get a tad uncomfortable if we were simply sitting in silence watching him carry out his task, or totally ignoring his presence and talking among ourselves.

Lunch session Part 2My bro suggested this Characters Cafe. I would never go or ask anyone to go to a character themed cafe. One has to preorder the meals and each meal cost $29.90 (all inclusive include tax and service charge). This is going to be one expensive lunch and of cos the two adults did not expect much from the food. When we arrived at the cafe, it was not opened. My brother was surprised cos he even came here personally a couple of days ago and made the payment. He walked over to another store which probably are related and the girl quickly went to open the cafe.The staff showed us to our table. The cafe is tiny, very tiny. I am glad I don't weigh 300 lbs. There are cute plushies everywhere. It is 100% kawaii!!She also turned on this humongous tv which probably is over 70" and it started playing Kungfu Panda 3. We looked around and snapped some pictures. The staff asked if we would like to have our lunch served and we said sure. I was a little puzzled; were we supposed to play with the plushies and when hungry, asked for our food? Note: the female staff was extremely friendly and nice. The kind who I probably can go sbux with.After a very very long time, the food came. The stew or soup was nice with generous chunks of potatoes and carrots. The gyozas tasted like chinese dumplings in dim sum places. The meal also came with a beverage and a snack.The meal definitely not worth the $29.90 each pax but hey at least there was the Rila Kuji ticket which was a sure win "scratch & win" ticket.

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: Dancing crab was recommended by my good friend. Dined with the entire family on our first night in Singapore. I didn't realize how big the portion sizes were and inadvertently ordered a bit much. It would have been more if our kind server hadn't informed us that we may be ordering too much food lol. We did want some assortment. The seafood was some of the best I have ever had. This is incredible and worth mentioning considering I think Singapore has to import some, if not most of it. Lol. It was expensive but it was also a lot of delicious food. You will not be disappointed with the quality, just be prepared for the bill.

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: 'Mala' Mayhemi (S$118++)Live Crab Combo with 'Mala' Sauce1 Live Sri Lankan Crab (approx. 800g), Prawns (350g), Flower Clams (350g), Spicy Chicken Sausage, Luncheon Meat, Crispy Fish Skin, Corn, Potato, Lotus Root, Okra and FusilliAvailable at @dancingcrabsg in @orchardcentral Accompanied with Hong Kong Amber Craft Beer (S$48++/ 5 bottles)Selected the lowest spicy level 'cos mom can't take too spicy. Very filling and deliciously spicy.Mom loves the juicy prawns. She said fresh too! Dad had a great time with the crab  and beer.Great service with disposable paper bags to keep the mask, wet tissues, disposable gloves, and disposable aprons on the table.Note  : there's a sink by the counter to wash hands if one don't like making the way to the loo.

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: I was very underwhelmed by my meal here. I had 350g of shrimp, 1 corn and the calamari. I sampled the "world famous" signature sauce it literally tasted like spaghetti sauce, so I went with the garlic butter, it was very bland and aside from the fact the shrimp were fresh I wasn't happy to eat it. The calamari, also fresh, was bland as well. The corn could have been cooked a little longer it was on the hard side. I had high hopes for this place being that it was packed but for $39SGD it should have been better. Plus the fact they had tissues to wipe your hands was really annoying being that you are eating with your hands. You need like 10 just to wipe your hands off. The crab will run you a pretty penny!

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: Crabs and prawns were fresh, pricey though. Go for the butter sauce. The signature spicy sauce was kinda tangy....the fun is to eat with your hands! Reservation recommended. Tip: it's great for birthdays as they served out cakes on a hilarious bed of seafood accessories and fried ice. Good fun!

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: So usually I try to stay away from American cuisine while traveling but we picked this place as a group and it was pretty good. I would give the food 5 stars, but service was really slow and would give that 3 stars, thus the overall 4 stars. Onto the food...We got the #1 combo with Sri Lankan crab ($88SD) and added on cornbread and fried okra. All was awesome. The combo also came with prawn (8-10), spicy sausage, clams and corn on the cob. All we're really good. We got the sambal sauce at a medium heat and it was great. Again my overall complaint is that the servers really didn't care about us being there and took forever to wait on us. The food was prompt once ordered though.

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: Great service and price/value for the end product.  I've been 3 times and find their food fresh, spiced just right and cooked perfectly.  Beignets are a great treat as well - highly recommend them.  Fast and clean / professional and customer focused.  A great place to eat!

address: 181 Orchard Rd #07-14/15, Orchard Central Singapore 238896 Singapore
comment: Seafood are fresh, weather you choose spicy or not, they are all very tasty. And the fun part is they serves the food on your table, yes I mean really on your table and for sure fingers licking because you have to eat with your hands. First time try this and if I will visit Singapore in the future, for sure will be back.

This is really one of the best tasting Dim Sum I have tasted not only in Singapore but around the world.Led by award winning Chef Fung Chi Keung and his team of top chefs, their exquisite tasting cantonese dim sum really UP their game to the next level.Xin Yue's innovative dishes, really tasted as good as they looked. Each dim sum dish was spectacular, with beautiful food styling and a creative take on classic traditional Cantonese recipes. Limted by the space in my tummy, i managed to try only afew dishes. Will definitely be back to savor other items on their menu with a bigger group.

Service was lame. Their recommended Pinor Noir was super lame. The food was good, but certainly not commensurate with the price. There's nothing wrong with Xin, per-se, but it's nothing outstandingly creative either :(Caveat: I only got vegetarian dishes, so it's certainly possible that they do meat phenomenally well.* Stir-fried Honey Pea, Celery, Lotus Root, Black Fungus, and Lily Bulb in Yam Basket - pretty damn tasty.* Mixed vegetable with vermicelli and gluten - the noodles were excellent, but the vegetables and broth were pretty meh. And it's marked vegetarian but comes with shrimp in the broth. So go figure.* Fried Sesame Balls with Liqueur and Red Bean Paste - pretty damn tasty, but not particularly unique. About as good as good sesame balls I've had anywhere else. But it was definitely decent.Overall I'd say there are probably better places for the price, so do yourself a favor and go find them.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I went during lunch and took the lunch set menu. It is actually a choice of main dish at a lowet price, but your options are limited. I went for the baja burrito which was filled with chicken, tomatoes, onions and guacamole. You get a bag of tortilla chips for free, for which you can grab a salsa (or more) from the free float salsa bar. The flavours were Ok, but for 10$ I would expect a bit more special.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Popped by on a weekday at 5pm and was pleasantly surprised to learn that OCBC Frank card members are entitled to 30% off their bill from 230pm to 530pm. I got the Baja burrito with no meat, and got it stuffed with veggies. Side note: if you don't like capsicum (bell peppers) like me, you will spend heaps of time removing them!My burrito came pretty quickly, and all orders come with free chips, which you can get your salsa fix at the salsa bar, which allows you to get as much as you want. I wouldn't say their salsa is amazing, but it is hard to get good tomatoes in Singapore, so I can't say I blame them. There are varying spice levels of salsa for your choice, but I got heaps of cilantro and lemon and stuffed my burrito with them both. The burritos here are pretty large so come here hungry or get them to cut it in two so you can share with a not-so-hungry friend. Pay $2.25 extra for a drink.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: So this a quick service Mexican food. You order from the counter but they serve the food to your table.Ordered the Baja burrito, Americano tacos and fajitas carnitas. All were pretty good and the portions were large. The drinks combo cost additional $2 were fountain drinks but the glasses provided were large.The free flow salsa bar seems ok but l guess can be better. There were several salsa and the one with black pepper was the best.The nacho chips and cheese sauce cost $2.95 each. May be it is free if you don't take it with the cheese.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I am a huge fan of "fast food Mexican" in the USA. Chipotle is my favorite, followed by Free bird's. Baja Fresh is certainly a tad lower on the list. They are not super prevalent in Texas and they are a tad pricier than the first two I mentioned. I heard that there was a Baja Fresh in Singapore.  I have been craving Chipotle pretty much since the day we landed in Singapore. We sought out the Baja Fresh and I am so glad we did! I had a chicken bowl and the portion was HUGE. There is a salsa bar to jazz up your food (even though none of it is too spicy) and my very picky children loved the queso. They have very refined queso pallets. They consider themselves experts!The service was fast and the staff was friendly. They also had a deal where if you checked in on FaceBook, you got a free order of cinnamon churros! They staff was so kind to bring two orders (one for each of my children). My children have those rave reviews too! I believe Baja Fresh will be in regular rotation for us!

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Went here for dinner with a few friends. The place is very lively and upbeat. The food was OK. They serve alcohol and that's a big plus.I'd recommend this place to anyone craving for Mexican food.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this place, REALLY.But alas, I left disappointed.I had the ultimo chicken burrito, which wasn't all that bad, but the ingredients definitely didn't taste fresh at all.My wife had the Mahi Mahi taco platter and towards the end of the meal she mentioned how this is the fishiest fish taco she's ever had. I tried a bite to judge for myself and I almost gagged. Wow, that was disgusting. It's either really old fish, or really bad, but it definitely didn't taste like mahi mahi. It was totally disgusting. I was surprised my wife ate her meal and felt really bad for her at the same time.I guess you can't really compare to a US Baja Fresh restaurant, but this doesn't much resemble a Baja Fresh... they are doing the franchise a big disservice if this is how Asia will be introduced to the Baja Fresh brand.This used to be my most favorite chain mexican restaurant in California... now I shudder at the thought of going to it again.Also, the prices are pretty ridiculous. $33 for 2 tacos and a burrito.No wonder the place was more than half empty during dinner time.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: The service here was really good. They were quick to attend to us and ask us what else we would like to order, how is our food,  are we enjoying ourselves etc.However, I can't really say the same for the food. The prices are are quite steep despite being a fast-food place and is not justified by the quality of the food. The meat had grits in them. The salsa sauces, guacamole and sour cream were nothing spectacular. The soft shell tacos and burrito tasted quite bready. I did quite enjoy the quesadilla though! However, food overall was a disappointment. For such prices and at such a location, I expected better. Although the food wasn't horrible, it wasn't very good at the same time. Would probably not revisit.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: $18+ for a chicken burrito and a coke. Add $2-3 for a different meat. Advertise "carnitas" but it's really just boiled shredded pork. Charge a service charge and GST for what? Bag of chips are cold and tasteless.  Don't foil wrap their burritos so its difficult and messy to eat them. Tasteless food. I get that they have pricey rent at this location, but there is no reason why the food they serve cannot be delicious. It's not.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: We tried the fish soft tacos, burrito and a fajita. I find the taste rather normal. It definitely has the novelty factor in Singapore where affordable mexican food is rather rare to find.Price wise, its cheaper than your regular mexican place but more expensive than a regular fast food place. Taste is average to above average. Service could use a bit more cheer.Decent options and customization is possible.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Mexican food is good for my soul! Located inside Hotel Rendezvous, it's unassuming exterior doesn't leave an impression. In fact the first few times I walked passed it without even noticing it was there!It's Mexican fast food but slightly pricier. Expect I pay about $15 per person for a set with drinks. I really love their burritos - I'd have an Ultimo steak burrito if I'm starving as the rice in it gets you pretty full up, or the Baja on a normal hunger scale as its got guacamole, meat and tomatoes but no rice.You can choose between chicken, beef, shrimp, pork or fish options, so there's something for everyone! Every set comes with a serve of nachos, and free flow servings of freshly made salsa and salsa sauces. I always go nuts on the fresh salsa. They promise that everything is fresh, so nothing from a can or freezer is used -which makes a remarkable difference. No reservations here, just walk ins so be prepare to wait if you come after 7pm. Fortunately, people leave quite quickly after eating so waiting time won't be too long. Ambience isn't great, but it's clean and comfortable, so i really enjoy my meals there.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: HORRIBLE!!!!!!! Baja Fresh Singapore should learn from Baja Fresh California.I'm from San Diego California, I go to Baja Fresh all the time over there. Over here however... I'll NEVER eat here again. First of all $30 for a beer and buritto? are you kidding me? The buritto was tasteless, the salsa had a heavy black pepper taste, it's NOT Mexican!!! This was the most expensive and worst tasting thing I've had, it's so bad I won't even call it Mexican food.DON'T EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Although it has the salsa bar counter just like the ones in the U.S.,, I was not impressed with the food here. The chicken fajitas came cold.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I loved the taco chips served and the salsa. Mexican food never disappoints but the portions were slightly small and expensive, as compared to other Mexican food options like stuff'd.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Closest thing you'll get to decent and (relatively) inexpensive Mexican food is probably Baja Fresh. Most Mexican places here are more of a sitdown, bougie (read: Bourgeoisie) style where you'll pay 20 bucks for a taco. Because it would be a cold day in hell (theres a joke in there about Singapore's weather somewhere) before I'd pay that much for a burrito, I spent a good amount of time on the hunt.After many sweaty treks through the city searching for a burrito, I happened to pass Baja Fresh one day on the way home. My prayers had been answered! While not 'the best thing I've ever had', Baja Fresh definitely hit the spot and fulfilled my craving. It's a shame that there's not more places where you can get a grab-n-go burrito (for a city that prides itself on eating, this is even more surprising). Alas, if you're like me, an American craving some south of the border fare, Baja Fresh will suffice.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I've never really had Mexican food before in Singapore. It just isn't as big here compared to Japanese or even Italian. So one day when my girl friend asked where we should go for dinner I decided to be adventurous and suggested Baja Fresh which I've heard and seen before!I was actually quite surprised when I went in because it is a fast food concept restaurant instead of a proper one. So you place your order at the counter and will be given a number, after which a wait staff will pass you the food.We were so confused when we first tried to order too! Everything is new to us, and there are not many pictures we can use as reference on the menu. The counter staff was really helpful though - she patiently explained each food to us and made recommendations.Really enjoyed the taco chips they gave as appetizers as well which you can dip into 5 types of salsa. Very fun!Our food was also very good. It was fresh! I never thought mexican food to be like that to be honest. Always had the image that it's all guacamole and beans.Go try it out now and see what I mean!

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I love Mexican food and I cook Mexican. Was looking forward to visiting the newly established Baja Fresh for quite some time before I finally got around to doing it. A meal here typically cost $15/person (unhappy me!), but it's still one of the cheaper Mexican food place in Singapore. It's fast-food restaurant styled; I totally disliked reading their menu. It was confusing.The meal was ok, really filling portions of nachos, tortillas, chicken(filling choice), cheese and drinks. it's free-flow salsa, 4 choices with my favorite being the 6-chile blend. They have a really general range of tex-mex food on their menu though; burritos, quesadillas, tacos, fajitas & nachos. The Mexicans will be angry they call these Mexican.They have an amazing group of staff working for them though and I like how these people made my experience at Baja Fresh so much better. I'd come by again to try other items; i think the salad in the corn tortilla bowl looks really interesting.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: The food is decent enough, but definitely not as fresh as it is in America. You can tell that the salsa is old and the cheese has been sitting in a packet for I don't know how long.This outlet overprices horrendously, charging $12 for a simple burrito that isn't even big enough for a proper meal. I could get double the quantity at Cha Cha Cha in Holland Village for the same price (with better ambiance).Even worse, this chain does not provide free water! When I went there, I took the spicy sauce and needed water but they flat out refused to give me tap water! They forced me to buy a bottle of water for $2.00 instead while my mouth was on fire. For a restaurant whose prices are so high, at least Baja Fresh could be classy enough to give free water, but I guess not. Furthermore, the staff is incredibly rude and hostile. I did not get a good vibe from either cashier whatsoever - they are cold and didn't even say "hello" back when I greeted them before ordering. Definitely put a bad taste in my mouth before the old pico de gallo had the chance.The only thing saving this place from a 1-star rating is the free nachos with every meal. I am surprised that a place as cheap as Baja Fresh (no free tap water!?!?) would provide this, but to be fair, there are only 5 or 6 nachos in the tiny bowl anyway. Still, I appreciate the thought. I have not been back to Baja Fresh since the first time and I do not recommend anyone who perhaps would like a drink of water after a spicy meal without paying $2.00 for a bottle of water, which not only is unnecessary spending but also harms the environment by promoting water bottles. Shame on Baja Fresh.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: love the baja burrito!i always order my steak baja burrito really well done (asked them to cook it a little bit longer than normal). love the chips, and the salsa bar.price is a bit steep..but it's worth it. thank you chandra for the tip about making the steak burrito really well done :)...now..if only chipotle would open a branch in singapore...my life would be complete (almost) :)

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Finally a place in Singapore that serves decent Mexican food!Baja Fresh is a Mexican chain from the states that serves fresh and healthy fast food. Be warned though, although this is technically a 'fast food joint' you are not going to be paying fast food prices. Its a bit pricey, but you are definitely getting what you pay for. All their food is made fresh and served fresh with really good ingredients. Portions are huge and you can help yourself to the salsa bar where there are different types of salsa. They also serve alcohol here which you dont see in other fast food restaurants. Id say one of the best places to get Mexican food in Singapore.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: When Baja Fresh's location was under renovation I was quite excited, because hey, tacos, and I don't have to go to Phoenix Park for it! Unfortunately, it's fast food that tries to be fresh but isn't really--don't get me wrong, it's not that the lettuce is wilting, but when you know that the char marks aren't real and the guacamole tastes like avocado juice from the Indonesian stall there isn't much that brings me back. There is a certain honesty in properly trashy fast food like Taco Bell, IMHO. That said, Taco Bell doesn't do beer. :)

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: Mexican food is good for my soul! Located inside Hotel Rendezvous, it's unassuming exterior doesn't leave an impression. In fact the first few times I walked passed it without even noticing it was there!It's Mexican fast food but slightly pricier. Expect I pay about $15 per person for a set with drinks. I really love their burritos - I'd have an Ultimo steak burrito if I'm starving as the rice in it gets you pretty full up, or the Baja on a normal hunger scale as its got guacamole, meat and tomatoes but no rice.You can choose between chicken, beef, shrimp, pork or fish options, so there's something for everyone! Every set comes with a serve of nachos, and free flow servings of freshly made salsa and salsa sauces. I always go nuts on the fresh salsa. They promise that everything is fresh, so nothing from a can or freezer is used -which makes a remarkable difference. No reservations here, just walk ins so be prepare to wait if you come after 7pm. Fortunately, people leave quite quickly after eating so waiting time won't be too long. Ambience isn't great, but it's clean and comfortable, so i really enjoy my meals there.

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: When Baja Fresh's location was under renovation I was quite excited, because hey, tacos, and I don't have to go to Phoenix Park for it! Unfortunately, it's fast food that tries to be fresh but isn't really--don't get me wrong, it's not that the lettuce is wilting, but when you know that the char marks aren't real and the guacamole tastes like avocado juice from the Indonesian stall there isn't much that brings me back. There is a certain honesty in properly trashy fast food like Taco Bell, IMHO. That said, Taco Bell doesn't do beer. :)

address: 9 Bras Basah Rd #01-03 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery Singapore 189559 Singapore
comment: I love Mexican food and I cook Mexican. Was looking forward to visiting the newly established Baja Fresh for quite some time before I finally got around to doing it. A meal here typically cost $15/person (unhappy me!), but it's still one of the cheaper Mexican food place in Singapore. It's fast-food restaurant styled; I totally disliked reading their menu. It was confusing.The meal was ok, really filling portions of nachos, tortillas, chicken(filling choice), cheese and drinks. it's free-flow salsa, 4 choices with my favorite being the 6-chile blend. They have a really general range of tex-mex food on their menu though; burritos, quesadillas, tacos, fajitas & nachos. The Mexicans will be angry they call these Mexican.They have an amazing group of staff working for them though and I like how these people made my experience at Baja Fresh so much better. I'd come by again to try other items; i think the salad in the corn tortilla bowl looks really interesting.

Place looks great..Maybe I got a bad night, the waitress did say they were changing the menu.I ordered the fish and chips with a small salad. Then told they don't have the salad. So I said I'm just after dinner greens, salad, veggies etc. I'm happy with anything.....  Traveling with work and desperately in need of greens lol.She goes and come back and says they can't help.Really? You don't have anything in the kitchen resembling veggies or salad. Hmmmm. I should have left at that point. :(So I ordered the burger. How did that come with lettuce?Thankfully I'm not a big eater, this thing is tiny.Closer look and the pale lettuce was brown and the tomato not in good condition. Guess that's why it wasn't acceptable as a salad.The bacon had no crunch, I'm guessing cooked previously and reheated.Beer was interesting, unfortunately the taster I did four of the five where flat.I'm am optimists, I'm going to give it another try.Will upload photos.

This was my first meal after arriving in Singapore and I must say that I was definitely impressed.  They offer mostly ramen with different broths.  There are a few other options including some tasty appetizers.The staff is vey friendly and helpful.  Do not be afraid to ask the difference between the different broths.  The staff will explain them in detail as they have taken pride in their dishes.  I chose the spicy broth which came with pork belly, hard boiled eggs, seaweed and onions.  The price range depending upon your choice is $16 to $23 Singaporean dollars (about $12-$17 USD as of 2016).  I also ordered the spicy gyoza ($5 SGD) and would recommend it as a must.Some of the best ramen I have ever had.
Great ramen gem found in Singapore. They have a huge selection on ramen and will even ask you how you world like your noodles. Soft, medium, or hard. Rated #1 with all of Asia

Ippudo is its name; ramen is its game. And ramen it does quite well indeed. We lucked out to get the last seats before the line was out the door. Was tempted to get the salmon ikura rice (because the picture looked good... rookie mistake I know) but was quickly corrected by my friend that I should get ramen so ramen I got. Ordering the Akamaru Shinaji, I enjoyed their take on "modern ramen" because it originates with the traditional tonkotsu broth but adds elements like garlic oil, black fungus, and a special miso paste. The broth is wonderfully rich and flavorful and the noodles had great spring-back texture too. Paired with a tall glass of beer, I was a happy camper. Despite being a busy eatery, the staff are still really attentive as they churn out bowl after bowl of ramen to hungry patrons. Afore mentioned line did grow but the wait isn't that bad so don't let that stop you from trying Ippudo.

First time having Ippudo outside of the States, and I was impressed with the consistency of the quality of the food. Just to note. This Ippudo is no longer called Ippudo x Tao, but now is just "Ippudo Mohamed Sultan". Regardless of the name, the food was tremendous.Starting with some aioli potatoes and the pork/shrimp buns, these dishes warmed up the appetite for the forthcoming ramen. Potatoes were soft, but still had some bit to them, so they were not like mashed potatoes; and had really good seasoning. The buns were just as I remember them from New York, except now I was able to enjoy them outside with a cold beer as well. And then there was the ramen. The Hakata Shoyu Special came with pork belly, egg, and seaweed. The broth was hot and flavorful. It was a bit stronger than the New York bowl, but finished a lot more smoothly (strange to be speaking about ramen broth like a whisky or wine - but it was that good). The pork was cooked perfect and added a nice bit of fat to the broth. I could not slurp down the ramen fast enough. If you're a fan of Ippudo, or just ramen in general, this should not be skipped.

We decided to pop by here because it opens till midnight on weekdays. Finding a parking spot on the road side parking was pretty hard but we managed. The ramen broth was so strong though good... I am pretty sure there's a lot more msg In it compared to normal ramen! But it's still good. A slice of char siew had me gulping down half a glass of ice water, it was that salty.. My friends tried their super doooper hard noodles which according to the waiter was noodles cooked in bowling water for a glorious 3 seconds.. Which means it's pretty much raw noodles.. But my friends loved it :)

There are so many great food places in this country I feel standards are high,  And in that respect this one a few short blocks from Fort Canning isn't a 5 star. But it's very good. I rate it 4 for consistency, good staff and the fact that we ate there about 5 times and my kids loved the fried chicken in a bun every time. :) The noodle dishes were also very good.

I've walked by this place dozens of times and it's beckoned me with it's red interior theme. We finally stopped over the weekend for dinner. We didn't bother with reservations, and the place wasn't packed (perhaps because it's so close to the restaurants on Robertson Quay). We started with two drinks from their menu: the Cassis Soda (black current liquor with soda and lime) and the Sunshine (cassis with gin and orange juice). They were a bit sweet, but very refreshing and helped with the warmth of the patio seat.We split a number of smaller plates rather than ordering main entrees. They included the potato salad, broccoli, chef's choice veggie skewers, scallops, salmon aburi roll, unagi roll (grilled eel, cucumber and egg, wrapped in a seaweed rice roll covered with flying fish roe), and crab frits. All were delicious and the crab frits were a tasty first for me. I was a fan of the fact that we could eat tapas-style Japanese and thought the food was unique and presented very well. There were many paleo-friendly options available. I'm sure that we'll be back.
Love ramenLove love late night ramen Love love love a perfect bowl of hakata ramen at Ippudo at midnight

Finding the entrance is tricky, walk down Mohamed Sultan to find a row of restaurants along the building's side.Ippudo's ramen flavor is consistent from location to location, they get great marks for that. What I find interesting is that the menus are different; this one is different from the one at Westgate (Jurong East). I still think it's a good, solid choice, but wish it weren't so expensive. Wah wah.Unlike some of the other locations, this location is less crowded.

I wanted to eat at Ippudo in Mandarin Gallery this weekend. But when we got there, the line was too long and I was really hungry so we left and ate somewhere else. When we took their business card, we noticed there was an Ippudo Tao in UE Square. The next day, I was still craving for Ramen and wanted to try Ippudo but we knew that on a Sunday afternoon the line would be even longer... So I decided to call Ippudo Tao and I was so happy when they said they do take reservations!! So off we went to finally have Ramen :-)I was pleasantly surprised and liked the place a lot. We were seated outside and it was so quiet and relaxing. The staff was really nice and very helpful on the food recommendation. They even ask you how you want your noodles cooked which I found wonderful!! I hate Ramen with soft overcooked noodles...I ordered the Bonito Tonkotsu Special and it is one of the yummiest Ramen i've had in Singapore! It was just delicious with a lovely broth and perfectly cooked chewy noodles. I was so happy to discover this place because not only the Ramen was good, but there was no lineup on a Sunday afternoon at 1:30pm. I will definitely go back!

not the best ramen, but not the worst. ippudo continues to dominate as a major market power in the global ramen scene with their tried and true formula of being the TGI Friday's of ramen. i usually get the classic tonkotsu or the akamaru, which is essentially just some spicy miso paste added.also of note, the ippudo's i've tried outside of japan (NYC, Singapore) are much worse than the ones i've tried in Japan (ginza and ebisu, with ebisu being the best so far).

It took me quite a while to locate this elusive restaurant, given its location in a relatively quiet corner of UE Square. After making a few circles, I finally stumbled upon its unassuming red-and-black exterior, and made my way into the restaurant greeted by an enthusiastic waitress.I ordered the signature Tao Kuro ramen, served in dark Shoyu Tonkotsu (pork bone) broth. The overall taste was similar to what I had in Japan, which is probably a compliment of the highest order: the chewiness of the noodles, the tenderness of the pork slices and the richness of the broth was just right. The egg ("tamago"), which is usually the make-or-break factor for me, did not disappoint: its yolk was deliciously runny, giving the near-perfect bowl of ramen its extra oomph. It's safe to say that I'll definitely be a regular patron of Ippudo Tao, despite its slightly higher prices.Reservations are strongly recommended as queues of up to an hour is usual during peak hours.
I've been three times now and it's a fine neighborhood option. I crave ramen regularly and this place doesn't fully satisfy but it does curb the craving.

Between this Ippudo joint and the one in Mandarin Gallery, there is no question that this one trumps in terms of convenience and hours. Great place to start a weekend night and fill your stomach before hitting the hard liquor..The ramen is pretty good. Hearty, tasty broth. Don't forget to mention to the server if you want to get your ramen cooked to a particular tenderness. I always get mine hard. I never tried the kakuni (pork belly) add-on, but the standard pork slices are okay. Not the best I have ever had, but still decent.I think people can afford to skip the famed pork buns. When I was in the States, I always make a point to get a bun whenever I go to Dave Chang joints.. but who needs that when you have plenty awesome kong bak pao stalls in Singapore?

Had the lunch set with karaage and shirosomething tonkotsu. The karaage was very good but the ramen broth felt a little lacking. I usually look for something heavier when I order tonkotsu. Still a pretty decent meal tho!

Had a decent lunch here, just the standard ramen with a pork bun on the side. It was good but nothing mind blowing. Staff was a bit pushy and hovered around quite a bit, but maybe that's because it was lunch on a rainy day and there was hardly anybody else there. 3 stars for being on the right side of good.

Decent spot for a ramen fix, if you are in the area. This a branch of the popular spot at Mandarin Gallery, and they've collaborated with a drum group (hence the TAO), so you can watch the drum shows while you eat.I find this the quieter branch (thankfully the drum shows aren't on all the time), and rarely have to wait to get seated.They've got a slightly different menu here too, and I'm particularly fond of the Tao Kuro Special - it's got everything on it, the onsen egg, pork belly (yeah, that's how I roll), and the seaweed too. You can get Ippudo originals here too, but why not try something different?Oh if you come at dinnertime, you can get some kushiyaki/skewers too, I can imagine they'd be great with a couple of beers.p.s. I like to come on weekends, when parking is less of a pain.

I come here more than many of the other ramen shops, even the ones I prefer, because the timings suit me better. When I'm craving ramen at 1 in the morning (which is too often, to the disadvantage of my health perhaps), I come here.It's got ramen till the wee hours of the morning and also hot green tea and Japanese beers or sake to wash it all down with. The big screen plays Tao drumming performances endlessly, so it's a good thing that it's quite pleasant to listen to and not intrusive in any way. I prefer the aka ramen here, although the plain-er Shiro ramen is quite good too, just like the one at the main branch at Mandarin Gallery. I like small, thin noodles so I always switch out the fatter ones for the smaller type of noodles.

After reading rave reviews about the place, my friends and I decided to try it out. Honestly, the ramen is really good, but I don't think it's worth that much of a hype. Besides the fact that we queued for about two hours, we didn't even dare to stay too long and hog the table as there was still a snake-like queue outside the restaurant. Serving only ramen, they offer a whole range of different flavours and soup-base to suit your taste.I should have just stayed on the safe side and ordered the normal soup base. Instead, I ordered the other one and felt it was too salty for my liking. I understand why people call Ippudo as their No.1 ramen shop in Singapore. The ramen noodles is really good and the people there are rather friendly too!Though I refused to share a table with others, my order came in rather fast! In less than 15 mins after we ordered our food, the bowls of piping hot ramen came in! Good food, good service but not worth your 2 hours wait.

This place is definitely different from Ippudo in Mandarin Gallery. The menu is different as well as the ambience.  You can make reservation early to get the seats in the restaurant else you mind ended up sitting outside, which is nice on a cool weather only. The food served wasn't properly cooked, the bbq chicken and beef were either too salty or too plain. Upon feedback, the waitress was kind enough to change a new dish for us but the taste was still off the track. If you prefer the outdoor, they have a huge TV that shows some Japanese drum performance continuously, luckily it was on silence, else it would be too disturbing to feast with the drumming sound.

My girlfriend was raving about the pork belly ramen, so I finally allowed myself to get dragged here.  Life is terrible, right?  The broth is exploding with flavour and the pork belly is so tender.  They even have Hitaschino Ale to cool you down as you slurp down steaming hot broth.

Ramen and beer is like chocolate and peanut butter. Both are served up plenty here.  They have a nice happy hour deal for sapporo. The ramen is the tastiest I've had in singapore. Now I cant say Ive been to every ramen joint in singapore but this is ALWAYS good.  You can choose a variety of broths, the chewiness of your noodles and an array of added bits like egg, pork cubes, etc.  Ive had a few of there other items. The yakitori is good but its not why I come here. They have some wasabi prawns which are pretty much consistently good no matter where I've eaten them.    The service is quick and friendly.  The atmosphere is interesting and stylish.  Definitely my go to spot for ramen.
Consistently good, a bit on the pricey side for ramen...  Still the best place in Singapore for me.

Japanese curry is very special because it's extremely delicious, can be eaten any time of day and the sauce is very hearty. I seeked the King of Curry, CoCo Ichibanya when I was in Singapore, I figure it'd be a cheaper option than to fly to Japan and try it there (hahaha).CoCo Ichibanya was decorated with cute murals on the wall and the menu was very extensive. For starters, you can reduce the amount of rice you want in the serving and add any toppings into the curry. Not only that, they also offer five different level of spiciness for the curry sauce.Hubby was tempted to try the extremely hot one and after much thought he decided on it. Hubby ordered extra fried chicken as an additional topping for his beef curry. I wasn't feeling well at that time but I figured spicy curry could cure my blocked nose so I ordered mine with level 3 and sweet corn topping.I reduced the rice for my beef curry which turned out to be perfect. Hubby was really full after eating his curry and questioned his judgment on why he ordered the extra topping. CoCo Ichibanya wasn't cheap if you considered the cost of extra topping or drinks, but the restaurant was definitely perfect for a family outing and quick lunch or dinner.We spotted a guy who ordered his curry with the extremely hot level and he had trouble finishing it. He was sweating bullets but of course a guy had to look strong especially when surrounded by two pretty girls that he shared his table with. We went out of the restaurant while eyeing him through the corner of our eyes. I think it boosted Hubby's confidence because he finished his curry without any problems at all (*evil smirk*).

A good place to go when you're craving Japanese curry! There's a lot of options to choose from so you're probably going to be impressed. I went here twice with my brother for lunch and it wasn't crowded at all. The order takes about 10-15 minutes to come, which is pretty decent. The food comes piping hot! So be careful when you take your first bite. I had the chicken katsu curry the first time I came with standard rice and level 1 hotness. Level 1 is the right amount of spicy for me, no more no less. The second time I got the pork tonkatsu omelette curry. I recommend the pork rather than the chicken. There's a lot of fat(?) for the chicken and the size of the chicken is very small. Overall, I really recommend this place. A good quite place to have a decent quality Japanese curry!

I like that you can customize your dish and opt for less rice, but the food itself was very average (2.5 stars). I got it slightly spicier than the regular and it was actually spicier than I'd intended but tolerable.

address: Plaza Singapura 68 Orchard Road #04-64/66 Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: Casual & affordable way to get your european fix! I came to the J8 branch pretty frequently in school, and this plaza sing brunch last summer while interning. The standard is quite consistent across both branches. Come for the lunch deals on Mon-Fri til 530pm: drink (coffee/tea, iced tea, soft drinks) + soup of the day + main course! I've tried the following here: salmon fillet + thai basil sauce (my FAVE. if you love spicy food this is the best!! The slab of salmon is also decent sized), seafood paella (yummy. a bit strong on the tomato taste, but texture is great), penne baby scallop & fish roe cream sauce. I've also tried the mussels and sausages, and had nothing to complain about them. Prices and portions are decent, but obviously the tastes aren't as refined as some other european places with higher price points, but thats fair. Ambiance is pretty nice, it's quieter and chill in the afternoons and you can take your time with your food.

address: Plaza Singapura 68 Orchard Road #04-64/66 Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: This place has large portions for reasonable prices. Unfortunately you get what you pay for.We had rosti, currywurst, drumlets and risotto with soft shell crab.The rosti was soggy rather than crispy, and came with a measly dollop of sour cream (though they gave us more when we asked for it). The portion of smoked salmon was generous though.The casing (skin) of the sausage in the currywurst lacked the firm knack/snap that a good sausage needs, and rather bizarrely it was served with truffle fries. I know everyone has a fetish for truffle fries nowadays, but adding truffle oil to currywurst fries really does not work.The drumlets were crispy enough but were a bit dry even when they were served.The risotto was okay if slightly dry, and the soft shell crab was alright also.

address: Plaza Singapura 68 Orchard Road #04-64/66 Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: Craving for European cuisine but can't decide what of Europe you want, just head to Ambush!From German pork knuckle, to French Duck Confit, to Italian pasta and even Spanish paella, one will be spoilt for choice! Value for money and a good selection of great tasting food, it's a great place to hangout with friends and family.

address: Plaza Singapura 68 Orchard Road #04-64/66 Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: Can't decide between Spanish food, French food or Italian pasta? Or perhaps some Swedish cheeseballs? Ambush is the place for you with its comprehensive dishes from the European regions. Or the local "European Union" might be a more apt description for that placeWe shared the classic Pork Knuckle ($18 for half) which was roasted moderately well, producing a crackly golden rind covering the tender meat and fats. But the pillowy mashed potato seemed to steal the limelight while the saukeraut was dry and too little for the meatOther interesting dishes include Squid Ink Paella, Coq Au Vin, their signature SAUSAGES......My love for black food includes not only chocolate but also squid ink dishes. In fact, this Spanish paella was my favourite dish of that day as the rice was sticky and full of flavour as compared to my previous try at OchreQuite value for money as the hearty main courses do not exceed $20 while pastas at average $13 :)

address: Plaza Singapura 68 Orchard Road #04-64/66 Singapore 238839 Singapore
comment: Food is tasty but the portion is small. Service is good and fast. Try the paellas!

It's been a while since Joe & Dough took over the Costa Coffee space at Plaza Singapura and yet, this is the first time that I am having coffee/cake at this outlet (all thanks to my daughter's chinese tuition class!).The seating area is much more comfortable then Costa's set-up. Luckily for us, we were able to find quite a few good seats on an early Saturday Afternoon.Definitely a cozy spot in the crowded shopping mall and will be back!

Run by authentic Thais, you'll expect nothing less. I skipped the usual green curry this round (thanks to an overindulging week) and went for their prawn glass noodle instead. Did not disappoint. Ambience is a little noisy due to the deco but it's still pleasant and it seems to be popular with the corporate folks working nearby. Definitely worth a visit just to check it out if nothing else.

The restaurant was located just above the MRT station, towards the end of the row of shophouses. The restaurant specialised in a particular type of hotpot which has its origin from Hainan, China, which is made using fresh coconut water as soup base with Kampong chicken and a special sand ginger sauce.Bamboo Fungus Coconut Chicken Pot 竹笙椰子鸡锅 (S$32.80) The soup base was light at first, and grew sweeter as the more ingredients were added. There was red dates, and hard pieces of coconut flesh in the soup. The chicken was pretty tender and was quite tangy with the sauce which was a mixture of sliced chillies, minced ginger, vinegar and a squeeze of lime. I was surprised there was no overwhelming flavour from the ginger. Some of the ingredients which we added into the hotpot were : Special selection pork shoulder 精选猪肩肉 (S$17)Sliced Pork Belly 涮五花肉 (S$14)Mix tan-O and cabbage 混合白菜茼蒿 (S$6)Mushroom Platter 菌盘 (S$9)Ring Roll 炸响铃 (S$6)Cheese Tofu 芝士豆腐 (S$8)We also had side dishes such as Fried Squid 经典炸鱿鱼 (S$8)It was quite addictive as it was chewy and crispy at the same time. Best accompanied with beer.Purple sweet potato cheese ball 紫薯芝士丸 (S$8)Encased with a thin crispy crust, one was quite surprised by the huge chunk of cheese in the centre of the mashed sweet potato.Signature Laamei Rice 腊味饭 (S$5)At first wanted to order the claypot version, but the restaurant ran out of ingredients, so ordered the small bowl version to try. The rice was quite frangant, with bits of waxed meat and dried mushroom in it.  Washed down the meal withSalted Green Tea with Lime 海盐金桔绿茶 (S$4.50)Not sure why but the drink reminded one of sour plum drink.Grapefruit Peach Tea 西柚蜜桃茶 (S$4.50)It tasted more like grapefruit juice to me.Ended the meal withCoconut Rice 海南椰子饭 (S$8)It was served in a coconut husk, cut up into 4 parts. The rice was soft and chewy, similar to glutinous rice part of Kueh Salat, with a touch of sweetness. There was bits of coconut flesh and red dates in the rice.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: There is always a line at this establishment. With such good Thai food and at such affordable prices, it is no wonder that many are willing to que and wait to taste their delicious cuisine.We ordered Prawn Cake, Pandan Leaf Chicken, Red beef curry, Drunken noodle, Egg omelette with crab meat, Mango sticky rice and Red Ruby desserts.All of the dishes were very good, of comparable quality to those in Bangkok. Our favorite was the red beef curry and drunken noodle. Prices are also very affordable. For a party of 4, and for all of the dishes I named above, our total bill came up to S$55. The only downsides are that the place is a bit warm as it is only partly air-conditioned. The loud music in the background also did not add to the dining experience.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: 2 of us queued up just before the outlet was opened for business. Yet we were treated like invisible. The rude woman just waved and the staff showed the 3 of them to a table, bypassing us. When I proceed indoor to take the last table, the staff made us to take the outdoor table which was pretty hot given it was noon time and there was no fan blowing outside whereas indoor there's fans on. Reason given that we were 2 persons, whereas the other groups got 3 persons. What kind of treatment was this! Yet when I was paying I could spot guys of 2 taking the tables for 4 indoor.Bad experience!Don't come here for small groups!

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: I'm only gradually getting used to waiting in line for food and typically I am not amused by a long line but WOW, this was worth the wait: this is the best Thai food I've had outside Thailand and it is super affordable!I came here on a Tuesday evening and it was the only place in Holland V which had a long line but I decided to give it a go anyway.  Good thing the line moved fast but we still had to wait for 45 mins but as it was not very hot outside, we enjoyed people watching. Also, it gave me enough time to extensively study the menu and decide what to get. A bonus is also that after a while they took our order whilst still being in line so once we got to our seats our food was served super fast.The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, it was obviously super busy but not in an annoying "full cantine" type of way, it was just bustling and when seated outside you could still enjoy the live music from Bar Bar Black Sheep across the street. I actually like that they use fans instead of aircon, this creates a cozier environment instead of a sterile place. The staff was very helpful which was unexpected since they were so busy.And then the food... Super delicious! We had the Shrimp Tom Yum soup, I am typically not a Tom Yum fan but this was super yummy (sorry for the bad pun).Since my dining companion preferred not to go for spicy dishes (except for the Tom Yum soup which had quite a kick), we went for the spring rolls, chicken in pandan leaves, green curry and pad thai. All of these dishes were fantastic, they tasted clean and had the right balance.I was in a pretty good mood when the check arrived as I noticed that there was no service or gst added. 27$ for two persons, what a bargain!Will I go again? You bet! Who doesn't love cheap, delicious food and good service?

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Used to be better. Quite disappointing really. The taste is way less authentic now. There's spice and heat but no depth of flavor. However, it's one of the cheaper options to eat around Holland Village though and it's filling.No ambience to speak of - expected since it's more of a quick street food experience. Very warm in the afternoon and they'll play loud music during peak hour.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Decent Prices for Average Food. There's something about Thai food that captivates everyone. Whether it's the over the top, burn your mouth off chilli or that combination of flavours that evokes all your senses at once, Thai food never fails to warm your heart and make you crave for more. Being a regular at Holland Village, we've seen the super long queues for Nakhon Kitchen and it's always made us wonder just how good the food is. We finally had the chance to try when, amazingly, there were less than 10 people in the queue. Waiting time was around 15 mins considering that most people had wanted to sit indoors instead of outside in the sweltering hit. Having a few favourite thai joints, we had to try some of our favourites. Tom Ka Chicken Soup ($6) Unlike most people who go on the search for the best Tom Yum soup, I love my Tom Ka. I love myself a god Tom yum but Tom Ka elevates that sour tanginess with the rich, smooth, sweetness of the coconut milk. There's was a good portion of chicken and mushroom and while it offered that tangy kick, it was a little light on the coconut milk. While it gave it that milky colour, the sweetness and richness of the coconut milk didn't shine through as much. Pineapple Curry with Mussels ($8)The one thing I admire about thai curries is their ability to use fresh fruits into their curry, adding that extra level of sweetness to compliment to spiciness and sourness. The curry here was pretty nice, thicker than I expected but really spicy and Because of that spiciness, it didn't really do much for the mussels. While the mussels were large and fresh, they didn't add a lot of flavour into the curry and vice versa. Maybe because there were only 5 mussels. Ironically, when I took the dish home, added in some coconut milk and cooked it with fish, it turned out to be a very good fish curry. Stir fried Kai Lan with mushrooms ($6)Kai Lan was not overcooked, which was nice. Mushroom, sliced, were juicy but the overall dish was just a bit too salty for me. I love the use of thai oyster sauce in vegetables, I use it a lot too in mine but this was just too heavy on the sauce. Thai Iced Tea ($3)This had to be the biggest let down for me. At $3, it was probably the most diluted or weak thai iced tea I've had. Overall, the food was decent but at the prices, I could see why they were so popular. Unfortunately for me, it really felt like the crowds were there more for the price than for how good the food actually is. For me, I'd still rather pay a little more and stick to my favourite Thai restaurants.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: This hole-in-the-wall, hawker-center like restaurant (no AC, outdoors) has one of the best, authentic and CHEAP Thai food ever. Not the freshest and best quality ingredients in dishes as the ones in expensive thai joints, such as Patara at Tanglin Mall, but it's authentic as you can get, as the ones you'd eat in a normal restaurant in Thailand. We frequent this place as it's near our home, and love that we can order 7~8 dishes without breaking the bank. and the portions are pretty great. The line forms out the door at 5:30pm when it's opened for dinner as any other cheap and great for value dining in Sing, so come early to avoid queue. Must gets: (all around $5~8/dish)-Pandan Leaf Chicken. Tasty and plump chicken, wrapped in the leaf!-pineapple fried rice-shrimp pad thai-tom yum soup. portion is great and delicious-Basil minced pork. D loved it as it's full of flavor. -Green Curry-thai ice teaso-so's:-Mango sticky rice: mango is expectedly not as sweet as the ones you'd try in Thailand, but we expected more from the rice. the rice was hard and tasteless.-cereal shrimp. a bit soggy and not worth getting it here. better to spend more and get the perfectly cooked one at Jumbo or No signboard!

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Great taste good value and prompt service.This is those well run small restaurants that keeps its customers returning for the great taste and good value.We ordered five dishes; Tom yum, green curry, stir fried asparagus, pandan leave chicken and pineapple rice.The green curry is a winner for me, always my favorite and this place got it right. The prawn were fresh, and the curry is rich with a nice aroma of coconut, basil, and the long beans and fig were crunchy. The stir fried asparagus is a surprise, a good balance of garlic brought out the sweetness of the asparagus, the carrots is probably there to add color, but the prawns here is probably frozen thawed type. Pandan leaf chicken is a biggest pleasant surprise of all, very tender like otah, chicken chunks soft. A definite repeat order.Tom yum is well prepared. Good balance of spicy and sour, and seafood prawn and squid is fresh, I don't normally order Tom yum on my own, but this dish is good enough for me to try.I would not order the pineapple rice next time round. No comments on the taste but I do think white rice will bring out the tastes of the above dishes better.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: An amazing place with amazing food! The service is very quick with friendly servers! Normally not a Thai food fan but this one stole my heart! Do check it out the next time you're hungry

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Thai restaurant in Singapore with several branches. Authentic Thai food at very affordable prices. Been here a few times when I crave Thai food. Curries, veggie dishes and Pad Thai are pretty good safe bets. Basil chicken a bit salty. Their Thai milk tea is very sweet though. Portion is a bit small - would recommend ordering a lot of dishes to share / sample.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: There's usually a line, and it's totally worth it. This is legit, bold Thai food. Cash only, but prices are very reasonable. Only giving 4 stars because spiciness hasn't been consistent for us. The first time, everything was spicy, in an amazing way. The second time, nothing made my nose run, and I was a little sad about that. Still, I'll definitely be back.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: An authentic Thai makan place. Their food are really good.....often orders their Basil pork (spicy and right amount of sweetness), stir-fried squid in yellow curry, kang Kong and of course, tom yam soup.Get prepare to perspire with the spice & freshly hot cook food.Oh yes, I always order the Fanta Green, it something that Singapore use to have long time ago..Bon Apertit...

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Cheap food, self service place, quality of the food not too good. Had the Pad Thai which was full of gristle and fat, seems to be the preferred way of eating chicken here in Singapore unfortunate. Wouldn't bother coming again.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Excellent  authentic  resto. Went on  a Saturday  arvo at lunch time.  Queue  was short.  We had minced beef salad, tom yam with prawns  and kangkong with belacan. The kangkong was not very spicy but definitely  could taste  the kick from the  belacan. Tom yam was with a clear broth and perfect  sour yet spicy taste. The mince beef salad was refreshing.  All up only 21 SGD. Well worth  it!

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Ok, not the best Thai food in the world, but probably the best value-for-your-money Thai food in Singapore. There's usually a queue here for dinner, even late into a weekday evening around 9pm, so just prepare yourself. They serve authentic Thai food including all the classics and a killer sticky mango rice dessert. The prices are very affordable for a serviced restaurant with seating and free napkins, and they don't have GST or service charge! My only qualm is the pork floss on top of the pineapple fried rice, which seems like a very Singaporean-style of preparation. Still, save yourself from the food court, Black Canyon, or Thai Express and eat at Nakhon next time you have a craving! I believe there's three locations throughout Singapore.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Came here with the recommendation of a friend who loves Thai food. He said that I may have to queue. I get suspicious whenever there's queue outside a restaurant in Singapore. Nevertheless, I gave it a shot. Arrived 10 minutes earlier as I don't believe in queueing for food. Order was taken and the nice lady told me with a smile that once the store it's opened, we will be served promptly. Very nice.Ordered Tom Yam soup, $6 and my favorite Phad Thai $5. The restaurant was half full 2 minutes after opening. Food arrived pretty quickly. Dug into Phad Thai and the soup. My heart sank. Why is it so sweet? The Phad Thai appeared to have a big bunch of sugar in it. Like wise for the soup. I have made both dishes at home and it can taste good without the sugar load. I looked around me and I can see patrons tucking enthusiastically into the sugar bin. For the easy on the pocket prices, I can see why it's so popular.Came here a second time and was hoping it will be better. The green curry chicken is horrible. It's frozen chicken and paste at best.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: The queue at this place is incredible. We arrived at 11:45am but the place only opens at noon sharp. We started the queue and soon there were quite a number of people behind us. Once the shutters open, everyone shuffled in and each waiter got assigned to a table. The service was very prompt without any compromise on quality of the food. The pandan chicken and prawn cakes were the highlight among our dishes. I felt that the Pad Thai did not have the wok hei smell. The prawns in the tom yum soup were big and fresh. The lemongrass drinks were also very refreshing as only the fans were switched on but not the air con.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Helluva wait, but it's all worth it. Best Thai food I've had in a long time. I would recommend chili prawn and kang kong belachan.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: I was pleasantly surprised to find Nakhon Kitchen in my neighborhood so I decided to go there with my parents. we went on a Saturday evening around 6pm and found ourselves behind a long line of people. we eventually sat down after 35 mins of waiting; orders were taken while we were in line so it helped speed up the serving of dishes. we ordered olive fried rice, pandan leaf chicken, seafood tom yum with coconut milk, whole red fish thai style, kang kong belachan, mango salad, and cereal prawn. i really enjoyed all the dishes and as other reviews have said, the pandan leaf chicken was very good. i was excited about the cereal prawn because it was only $12 for quite a huge portion (based on what i saw on other tables before i ordered). the prawns didnt fail me and they were pretty big, fresh and succulent. i did however think that the cereal was lacking a little in taste when compared to what they serve at the zhi char stalls. for all that, including a mango glutinous rice to go and a coconut drink as well as a glass of lemon grass drink, we paid $67 and took home enough food for lunch next day. this place is certainly value for money! i would definitely go again!

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Busy, they don't take credit cards and they forget your order... food's pretty good though! I loved the mango salad

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Standard just constantly dropping and they obviously play very loud Thai music so as to deter customers from staying longer than normal.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Great tasting thai food! The line gets pretty long during dinner time, but the good thing is that they take your order while you are in line. When you get seated, your food is handed to you quickly. I love the pad thai here, probably the best I have tasted in Singapore so far. Also I recommend trying the green tea here!

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: Great thai place with authentic dishes and drinks. They have a good selection and their prices are really affordable ! Greatly recommended ! Come early as the place is always crowded

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
comment: I went a few times and this will be the last time I went.  Food are the same standard but the services are still cold and chaotic, I waited 10 mins trying to get the bill, no one seems to care, I looked in the menu and left the cash behind then left, not feeling very comfortable about it. Well, people come for the price of the food not the service.

address: 27A Lorong Liput Holland Village Singapore 277738 Singapore
